Recently, she borrowed a loan of 9,500 PHP from Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to buy additional inventory. She wants to improve her business for better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory for her store.

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
Concepción, requiere optar por un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo  para seguir invirtiendo en su actividad; este le permitirá comprar un toro para sus vacas y así reproducir su ganadería.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo mucho, ya que se ha convertido en una distribuidora de lácteos en su lugar donde vive; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Concepción needs to request another loan because she needs more working capital to continue investing her business. This will allow her to buy a bull for her cows, so she will be able to breed her cattle. 

The previous loan was very helpful for Concepción. She has become one of her town's dairy distributors. Her financial and family situations have improved.

loans.use: to buy a bull for her cows so she will be able to breed her cattle.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana, age 57, is a housewife. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband is a tailor by profession. This business is the only source of income for the family. He wants to purchase a sewing machine so that he can work more efficiently and professionally.

For that reason, Rukhsana is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan to purchase a sewing machine. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to invest in household needs. Rukhsana hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Radilla

texts.en:
Radilla is from Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City, Philippines. She is 35 years old and married. Radilla has three grown dependents. She owns and operates a small retail store at home to support her daily needs. For years, she has been able to manage the store smoothly. Every month she receives PHP 7,000 from her business activity. 

Radilla is aiming to expand her business activity. To overcome her tough financial experiences, Radilla joined GDMPC to have the chance to access financial services.   In order to buy rice and corn grits to sell, she borrowed a loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit.  With the probable revenue to be gained, Radilla hopes to sustain their livelihood and sell more products to increase the regular monthly income she receives.

loans.use: to buy rice and corn grits to sell

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Dorina

texts.en:
Dorina, a 38-year-old married mother of six, is from Carmen Annex, Ozamis City where she has been operating a specialized general store selling a variety of food products in the local community for ten years. She earns 9,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Dorina joined GDMPC, and she is now requesting a loan of 29,000.00 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Zohra's Group

texts.en: Zohra, age 46, is a housewife. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband is a milk seller by profession. This business is the only source of income for the family. Zohra is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan to purchase a buffalo for his business. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to invest in household needs. Zohra hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma is 32 years old and married with two children. She is from Migcanaway, Tangub City. For the past years, Delma has been cooking and selling daily dishes to earn a living. She earns 5,000 PHP a month for her work. Aside from this business, she has been operating a service-based business providing motorcycle transportation and motorcycle rental for more a year. 

Delma is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy a new set of tires. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires

loans.name: Aracelle

texts.en: Aracelle is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Aracelle is married and has two children. To make a living, Aracelle runs a retail store. Aracelle has been engaged in her business for years and earns 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. Aracelle is requesting a loan of 7,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods, sugar, milk and sachet products. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, sugar, milk and sachet products

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
For the last four years Anwar, who lives in Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, has been earning an income of 3,000 PHP each month by providing transportation services to support the needs of his two children. For the 30-year-old father, there’s nothing that can make him more happy than to see his children successful in their studies.

Anwar, who joined GDMPC in 2010, has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to buy new tires. His plan in the future is to improve his business so he can provide his children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy new tires

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
This is Virginia. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more vegetables and other products for her business. The loan also helped in their everyday expenses. She only has one child living with her, and she is already a widow.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan for her to purchase more vegetables and other products needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Virginia hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams to have a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is married and a mother of two dependent children. She is 32 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Lolita makes and sells furniture to earn a living and has had this business for four years. She earns 4,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase materials for furniture making. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for furniture making.

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia, 30 years old and married to David, supports a family of four. She buys and sells fruits and vegetables in Kericho town; her source of income for the last eight years, the business earns her an average monthly income of Kshs 10,000.

Anastasia has requested a loan of Kshs 30,000 to purchase more stocks of fruit to boost her sales. She anticipates using her new profits to expand her business. She also hopes to improve her living standards, be financially stable, and save enough money to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase fruits

loans.name: Vince

texts.en:
Vince lives in Cilegon, about two hours from Jakarta.  Cilegon is known for Krakatau city. Vince manages a small shop selling mobile phone airtime credit.  Vince is married and living with her five children and husband in the family home. 

Vince joined Ruma three years ago because she wanted to improve her family's income.  With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Vince sees improvements in her shop.  For the last three months, she earned an average of $140 - 145 in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  She hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions.  Her goal for her business is to expand to more new businesses in the future

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy children's clothing, toiletry items and lingerie.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah, who is single and lives in Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, has been providing transportation services and motorbike rentals to local community members for five years; every month she earns PHP 8,630.00.

Leah, who became a member of GDMPC this year, is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000.00 to repair an existing vehicle for better service. In the future, she hopes to finish her studies and earn more income from her business.

loans.use: to repair her vehicle for better service

loans.name: Ulysses

texts.en:
Ulysses, who is from Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, is 32 years old, married and has one child. To make a living, Ulysses owns and operates a motor transport service. Engaged in his business for five years, he earns PHP 4,000 a month.

A member of GDMPC since 2008, Ulysses is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000.00 from GDMPC micro credit to purchase spare parts and accessories for his motorcycle. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and accessories for his motorcycle

loans.name: Sinorina

texts.en:
Sinorina is married. She has a shop to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to run a big business, but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan, and she is applying for her second loan of $1,000. 

She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store, such as secondhand clothes, secondhand shoes and secondhand bags. She is happy that TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes, secondhand shoes and secondhand bags.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is from Poblacion 3, Clarin. She is 47 years old, married and has four children.To make a living, Fely is operating a general store. 

After she had encountered a health problem, which made her use her capital and profit to pay for hospital bills and medicine, her business was stopped for a few days. But despite this, she never lost hope to stand up again. Being a member of GDMPC, she then requested a new loan of PHP 9,000 to reopen her store and be able to purchase goods for sale. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated as a result of the loan to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase goods for sale.

loans.name: Mansha

texts.en: Mansha is a 51-year-old man. He is a father of seven children. He works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. He owns a shoe shop in the main market which is the only source of income for his family. Mansha is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for his shoe shop. He will use the loan amount to buy rexine, foam, and thread for manufacturing shoes. These supplies will enable him to respond quickly to customer needs. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. Mansha hopes that the loan will be helpful for his business. He is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy rexine, foam, and thread for manuracturing shoes.

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth tiene 37 años de edad, tiene tres hijos. Se ha dedicado desde muy joven a realizar comercio informal, ella se caso muy joven y por la misma situación le ha tocado trabajar para cubrir los gatos del hogar. Ella siempre ha realizado actividades como venta de comida, venta de productos por catálogos, ella vive con sus tres hijos y es madre soltera que ha luchado por sacar adelante a sus hijos al punto que la hija mayor se ha graduado de bachiller y es quien le ayuda con los oficios de la casa.

Como el comercio lo realiza de forma intermitente o cuando le solicitan la elaboración de comida, ella visita la ciudad para comprar todos los insumos y poder estar preparada para cubrir las necesidades. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para colocarle el piso a su vivienda. Actualmente, lo tiene solo de cemento pero ella quiere colocarme piso de cerámica en vista que en su misma casa ella planea instalar una pequeña piñatería, conoce de este oficio; pero por falta de un local idóneo no la ha podido instalar.

Al remodelar su vivienda instalar en su misma casa de habitación el negocio que siempre ha planeado tener y con ella ofrecer un servicio poco común y que a pesar de ello presenta demanda por parte de los habitantes de la comunidad, ella siempre ha visto como ir de a poco mejorando su casa y poder tenerla cada ves mas bonita.

Si bien es cierto el objetivo principal del crédito es mejorar la vivienda, ella al instalar el negocio y ponerlo a funcionar ella obtendrá mayores ingresos y además podrá dar una actividad productiva a su hija que será su mano derecha al implementar este negocio.

Al consultarle a la señora sobre los planes que ella tiene a futuro,  manifestó que siempre ha soñado con tener su propio negocio en donde administrarlo junto a su familia y en poder tener ingresos sostenibles en el tiempo para poder ofrecer el legado de la educación a sus hijos pequeños para que estos puedan ser personas de provecho dentro de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Ruth is 37 years old and has three children. From a very young age, she has been selling informally for a living. She married very young and as a result of that situation, she’s had to work to cover the household expenses. She has always engaged in activities like selling food and selling products by catalog. She lives with her three children and is a single mother who has struggled to get her children ahead. Her oldest daughter has graduated from high school and she is the one who helps with the housework.

The selling is done on an intermittent basis or whenever she is requested for food preparation. She visits the city to buy all the supplies and to be prepared to meet the needs.

The loan she is requesting from Fundación Campo is to lay flooring in her home. Currently, it is just cement, but she wants to lay a tile floor seeing as she plans to set up a small piñata shop there. She is familiar with this type of business, but for lack of a suitable place, she has not been able to set it up.

After remodeling her home, she will set up the business that she has always planned to have and with it offer a rare service, although it has demand from the community. She has always been looking at how to slowly improve her home and make it more and more beautiful. 

While it is true that the main objective of the loan is to improve her home, by getting her business up and running, she will earn more income. She will also be providing a productive activity for her daughter, who will be her right-hand person in implementing this business.

When asking her about the plans she has for the future, she said she has always dreamed of having her own business and run it with her family. She also dreams of having a sustainable income so she can provide the legacy of education to her young children so that they can be useful people in the community.

loans.use: to lay flooring in her home.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en: Jerry is 49 years old, is married and lives in Sebasi Clarin, Philippines. His three children have already finished their studies. Jerry manages and cultivates a corn farm as his main source of income. Jerry earns PHP 5,000 every month with this work. He has requested a loan of PHP 6,500 to buy fertilizers, such as manure, and to finance the costs of weeding maintenance. Jerry has been a member of GDMPC since 2008. His future plan is to see his children become successful.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, such as manure, and to finance the costs of weeding maintenance.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 25 years old, is married to Eduardo and has three children. She buys and re-sells junk such as old newspapers, bottles and plastics. She has been in the business for over two years now and usually earns P300 a day. 

She would like to increase her income but has insufficient capital. This leads her to seek the financial assistance of KIVA lenders through ASKI in asking for a loan of P5,000. The loan amount will be used for purchasing more bottles, empty cans, and old newspapers to sell. 

Maricel is hoping that someday she can improve her small business and, in the meantime, keep providing for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy more bottles, empty cans and old newspapers to sell.

loans.name: Azhar

texts.en: Azhar is a 52-year-old, married man. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan with his family. His wife is a very hardworking and responsible housewife. Since 2007, Azhar has been running a fast food shop, the only source of income for the family. Currently, he needs to buy cold drinks, chicken, burgers and salad for his shop. He has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to pay for those supplies. This loan will not only help him to grow his business but will increase his net income and savings as well. He hopes to provide a quality education for his children. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cold drinks, chicken, burgers, and salad to sell.

loans.name: Alijon

texts.ru: Аличон житель села Адолат, джамоата Гулистон города Вахдат. Он 36-летний женатый мужчина, имеет троих детей. У него высшее педагогическое образование. Аличон работает учителем в сельской школе. В данный момент Аличон хотел бы начать новую деятельность, чтобы улучшить условия проживания семьи. Его интересует птицеводство, а именно разведение кур. Во дворе своего дома Аличон уже построил курятник. К тому же он имеет стартовый капитал в размере 500 TJS. В их кишлаке пока никто не занимается этим бизнесом и поэтому у него не будет конкурентов. Аличон запрашивает кредит в размере 400$. Он на сумму кредита вместе с суммой своего сбережения хочет купить 80 кур и начать свой бизнес. В разведении кур ему будет помогать его мать, которая имеет в этом опыт.
texts.en:
Alijon lives in the village of Adolat, in the Guliston district of Vahdat.  He is 36 years old, married, and has three children.  He has a degree in teaching and he teaches in the village school.  At the present, Alijon would like to start a new business in order to improve his family's living conditions.  He is interested in the poultry business but, more precisely, in raising chickens.  He has already built a chicken coop in his yard and he has 500 TJS in start-up capital.   No one else in their village raises chickens, so he will have no competition.  

Alijon is requesting a loan of 400 USD.  With these funds, in addition to his capital, he wants to buy 80 chickens to start his business.  His mother has experience raising chickens and will help him with his business.

loans.use: to buy chickens to start a poultry business

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana runs an open pharmacy, which helps her to generate income for her family. Juliana is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy stock, such as drugs, to keep in her store. She opened her pharmacy in 2002 with her own working capital of $500. She is a hard working woman and hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock, such as drugs, for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married with five children, and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (sisters). She has a business of selling phone accessories and has been in this business for 1½ years. 

Sarah has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more phone batteries, phone chargers and airtime. She generates additional income through bananas (green). She works in a shop and sells on a retail basis for seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality.  

She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to build rental rooms. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more phone batteries, airtime and phone chargers.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a vendor from Linao East, Tuguegarao City. She sells fruits and vegetables to the people in their village. Victoria is 53 years old, has five children and is already widowed. She is very thankful for the business she has because she is able to sustain her family's needs. 

She wanted to increase her sales but has a lack of funds. She is asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy a variety of vegetables to sell, such as cabbages, eggplant, tomatoes and onions. She believes that this will help her achieve a good income to benefit her family.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, eggplant, tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Melecio

texts.en:
Melecio is 35 years old and single. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

To earn a living, he owns and operates a food-vending business, selling dried fish, canned goods, coffee, and sugar in the local community. He has had this business for over three years and earns PHP 5,000 every month. 

Aside from doing this, he also operates a service-based business, providing motor transport in the local community. He joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2011 and recently requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase tires and motor accessories. He wants to save money for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase tires and motor accessories for his motor transport business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of accessories needed in her business.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a 46-year-old married man with ten children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. After realizing that farming alone could not meet the day to day needs of his family, he decided to set up a retail shop and, also, to sell bananas. Jackson is requesting a loan to buy sugar, soap, salt and flasks to sell.

Like all good fathers, he dreams of educating his children through college and setting up sustainable, income-generating activities for them. High license fees and inadequate capital to meet demand are his major challenges. He dreams of having a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, salt and flasks to sell.

loans.name: Mavludakhon

texts.ru: Мавлудахон 23-летняя замужняя женщина, проживающая в городе Вахдат. Она способная, усердная женщина. У нее среднее образование. Мавлудахон умеет вышивать женские национальные платья и теперь хотела бы использовать свое мастерство на профессиональном поприще. Мавлудахон собирается открыть швейное дело у себя дома. Она уже отвела отдельную комнату для новой деятельности. Но чтобы начать деятельность ей необходимо купить швейную машинку. С этой целью Мавлудахон обратилась за кредитом. Она на сумму кредита вместе с суммой своего сбережения хочет купить компьютерную швейную машинку и ткани. В среднем за месяц она планирует вышивать по 40 платьев. Это будут и обычные платья и платья с разными красивыми вышивками. Об умении Мавлудахон конечно же знают ее близкие и родственники, которые и будут ее первыми клиентами. Мавлудахон верит, что Вы поддержите ее в открытии собственного швейного дела и заранее выражает Вам свою благодарность.
texts.en:
Mavludakhon is a married 23 year old woman who lives in Vahdat.  She is a talented and hard working woman.  She has a high school education.  Mavludakhon can embroider traditional women's dresses and she would like to use her mastery of this skill professionally.  Mavludakhon is getting ready to open a sewing business in her home.  She has already prepared a separate room for her workshop.  But in order to start the business, she needs to buy a sewing machine.  

With this aim, she has applied for a loan.  With the loan funds and her own savings, she wants to buy a computerized sewing machine and fabric.  She plans to embroider 40 dresses per month on average.  This includes both every-day dresses and dresses with beautiful embroidery of varied designs.  Of course all of her friends and family know about her skills and they will be her first clients.  Mavludakhon is sure that you will help her open her own sewing business and would like to express her gratitude to you in advance.

loans.use: to buy a computerized sewing machine and fabric to start her new business

loans.name: Constatine

texts.en:
Constatine is a 62-year-old, married man with 15 children, living in Masindi, Uganda. 

He has been selling charcoal along the highway since 1993 and also does farming to earn additional income. He has hopes of constructing a permanent house for residence, although theft is a great challenge. He also says that if he had enough capital, he would venture into more environmentally-friendly sources of energy, such as solar, as he acknowledges the effect of his current business on the environment. 

Constatine is requesting a loan to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Micheal is a 34-year-old, married man with one child, living in Masindi, Uganda. 

He deals in selling spare parts along with earning a salary as a teacher. With his meager income, he has been able to educate his child and buy land. He has hopes of completing construction of his house and rehabilitating his banana plantation, although banana pests and theft are his major challenges. 

Micheal intends to use the loan to buy iron sheets for roofing his house.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets for roofing his house.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is a 45-year-old, married man with four children, living in Masindi, Uganda. 

The sole responsibility of looking after the family rests on him and his desire is to educate his children up to the University level and construct a permanent residence for them. He sells clothes for a living and the business has been very lucrative, despite challenges of stiff competition and price fluctuation.

Mario intends to use the loan to buy building materials, such as cement and sand, to complete his house.

loans.use: to buy building materials, such as cement and sand, to complete his house.

loans.name: Maximina

texts.es: Maximina tiene 45 años, está casada y vive en su casa propia construida en base de adobe con dos de sus cuatro hijos y su esposo. Los padres de Maximina compraron un terreno agrícola cuando recién se mudaron a su localidad. Este terreno ahora es propiedad de Maximina y se ha convertido en el principal sustento para su familia, en estos terrenos ella siembra cacao y café orgánico. Maximina contrata trabajadores que le ayudan a mantener en buen estado sus sembríos. Típicamente usa abono orgánico para fertilizar sus terrenos y así pueda vender sus productos en el mercado central. Uno de sus principales objetivos a largo plazo es comprar un terreno adicional en donde planea sembrar café y generar más ingresos con el tiempo. Este es su segundó préstamo con KIVA y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas en forma responsable. Con el monto de 4,000 nuevos soles comprara 7 sacos de abono orgánico y plantones de cacao para reemplazar varios árboles de cacao que ya están desfasados.
texts.en:
Maximina, age 45, is married and lives in her own house, which is made from adobe, with her four children and her husband.  Maximina’s parents bought farm land when they had just moved to the area.  This land is now Maximina’s property, and she has converted it into the main support for her family.

She grows cacao and organic coffee on this land.  Maximina hires workers to help her keep her plants in good condition.  She typically uses organic fertilizer to fertilize her land.  This way she is able to sell her products at the central market.  One of her main long term objectives is to buy additional land where she can, in time, grow coffee and generate more income.

This is her second loan with Kiva.  She pledges to make her payments responsibly.  She will use the 4,000 soles to buy seven sacks of organic fertilizer and cacao plants to replace various cacao trees that are now obsolete.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and cacao plants.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
This is Lorena. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more fruits and vegetables needed in her business. The loan also helped in her household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday income.

Lorena would like to apply for another PHP 35,000 loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lorena dreams to be successful in her business and hopes to give a good future to her child. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for variety of fruits and vegetables to sell in her market stall.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is 20 years old and lives with her family. She is studying at the university. In addition, she is also working as an administrative intern at a well-known business in her town. 

With the support from this loan, Hazel plans to pay her university tuition, as well as cover the cost of books and study materials. She is grateful for this opportunity and the support she has received, and she plans to put her studies to good use by getting a job to support her family.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Lusia

texts.en:
A loan of $1,000 is offered to Lusia to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to shop every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee and other items. 

She has been involved in business activities since 2013. She feels very comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee and other items

loans.name: Asghar

texts.en:
Asghar is a 41-year-old married man. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan with his family. His wife is a very hardworking and responsible housewife. 

Since 1997, Asghar has been running a dairy farm, which is the only source of income for the family. He wants to open a milk shop in urban area where he can sale milk directly to the customers instead of retailers. For that he needs additional capital, therefore he has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. 

This loan will not only help him to grow his business but will increase his net income and savings as well. He hopes to provide quality education for his children. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: for opening a milk shop.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Mr. Ashraf is a 51-year-old man who lives with his family in Lahore, Pakistan. Since 2005, Ashraf has been supplying construction materials, which is a very successful business for his family. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. 

He is currently in need of purchasing building materials for his shop, such as bricks, cement, and sand. But, due to financial constraints, he finds it difficult. Therefore, he has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help him to grow his business, but will also increase his net income and savings. Ashraf is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy building materials, such as bricks, cement, and sand.

loans.name: Cholpon

texts.ru:
Чолпон 41 год, имеет 3 детей. Чолпон в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством, полеводством , стартовав этот бизнес в 1995 году с 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Чолпон, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 1 корова, 5 овец, арендованная земля в 1,67 га засажена картошкой и фасолью. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чолпон обратился в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку  мелкого рогатого скота и селитры.  Доходы от кредита Чолпон планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса, и намерена оплачивать обучение средней дочери – студентки.
texts.en:
Cholpon is 41 years old and has three children.  Her family's main source of income is Cholpon's farming and animal husbandry business, which she started in 1995 with 10,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her hard work, today Cholpon has one cow, five sheep, and 1.67 ha of rented land that is planted with potatoes and beans.  

With an aim to further developing her business, Cholpon has applied to the microfinance bank of Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of sheep and saltpeter.  Cholpon plans to reinvest the additional income in her business and she is intent upon paying her middle daughter's school tuition.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and fertilizers

loans.name: Homiya

texts.ru: Хомия трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и имеет 4 детей. Ее старший ребенок совершеннолетний, а 3 младшие еще не совершеннолетние. Хомия в течение 6 месяцев она работает в средней школе. Она преподает математику. Хомия данное время является студенткой 1 курса, заочного отделения, факультета Информатики и математики. Она хочет усовершенствовать свои знания. Она должна заплатить за свой договор, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Homiya is a hard working woman.  She is married and has four children.  Her eldest child has reached the age of majority, but her three younger children are still minors.  Homiya has been working in a secondary school for six months.  She teaches mathematics.  Homiya is also a first-year student in the part-time department of the university's School of Computer Sciences and Mathematics.  She wants to improve her knowledge.  She needs to pay her tuition, but she doesn't have the money.  She is requesting a loan to pay her tuition.  She is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition at the university

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of salt, sugar, sardines, noodles, soft drinks, shampoo, oil, bread and milk to sell

loans.name: Lanie Rose

texts.en:
Lanie Rose is from Malaubang, Ozamiz City. She is 31 years old, married and has three school-aged children. She owns and runs a motorcycle transport service, ferrying passengers around on her motorcycle.

Lanie Rose is applying for a 13,000 PHP loan through GDMPC which will be used for maintenance and repairs on her motorcycle. Her future plan is to transform her house into a better shelter for her family.

loans.use: to finance the costs of maintenance and repairs on her motorcycle.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en: Carolina is 30 years old, married and has four children. Being a hard-working mother, she supported her husband in cultivating their farm land by planting a variety of vegetables to sell. She and her husband wanted to improve their farming business to generate sufficient income and save for the future of their children. For this, she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000.00 to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides needed in vegetable production. She hopes that her loan request will be granted for them to improve their farming business and with it their living status.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie, 43, is grateful for having a family that is very helpful, loveable, and kind. This motivates her to work harder. 

She is currently selling dried fish and is seeking additional working capital of PHP 12,000. The loan will be used to purchase a variety of dried fish to sell in the market. This will enable her to earn a higher income. 

Melanie is hoping that, through her hard work, they will have a better life, someday.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of dried fish.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
This is Helen. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Helen hopes that her business will be more successful and dreams to have her own house. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
This is Rosanna. Her previous loan was a big help in her food stall business. She was able to buy more products and ingredients needed in her business. The loan also helped in her everyday expenses. She is a widow and she works hard to provide for her family's everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rosana hopes to have a restaurant and dreams to always have a good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
This is Lydia. She previously accessed a PHP 10,000 loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials, like fabric, thread, and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another PHP 10,000 loan to buy additional supplies of raw materials, like  thread, needles, cloth, and other supplies needed in her tailoring business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lydia hopes to maintain the stability of her business and dreams to have good health. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for thread, needles, cloth, and other supplies needed in her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is a 50-year-old married man with eight children living in Kasese,Uganda. He has been selling eggs for 10 years and also does farming to earn additional income. He started the  business to pay for the education of his children. He hopes to have broilers which have a higher market value. However, chicken feed is very expensive which poses a challenge to his business growth. William intends to use the loan to buy chicks and chicken mash.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken mash.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is a 28-year-old, single woman, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She is a policewoman who earns a monthly salary from the government. With the proceeds, she has been able to support her aging parents. Low pay and unfavorable working conditions are her greatest challenges, while her dream is to start up a business and construct a house. 

Constance intends to use the loan to buy bricks and cement for construction of her house.

loans.use: to buy bricks and cement for construction of her house.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina, requiere optar por un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio; este le permitirá comprar una plancha para pupusas  y café para tostar, luego venderlo.
El efecto del crédito anterior le ayudo a darle vida a su negocio y seguir trabajando en el oficio; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se mantienen igual.
texts.en:
Reina needs a new loan because she needs working capital in order to continue investing in her business.  This will allow her to buy a griddle for ‘pupusas’ [stuffed griddle corn cakes] and coffee to roast, which she will later sell.

The previous loan helped her to give life to her business and to continue working in this field.  Her financial and family circumstances remain the same.

loans.use: to buy a griddle for pupusas and coffee to roast and then sell.

loans.name: Tibon

texts.en:
Tibon is a farmer who is raising his family in a rural community. He is 45 years old and has four school-aged children. Being a responsible parent, he wants to earn enough to provide his children with a good education.

Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, Tibon plans to expand his vegetable production to increase his yield and income. To realize his plan, he is applying for a 10,000 PHP loan to buy the seed, fertilizer and pesticides needed in vegetable production.

Being a hardworking father, Tibon believes that he will improve his family’s living standards through hard work and financial assistance from lenders.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is a single hardworking man taking care of one child. He has been cattle keeper since 2006. Over the years his milk production has increased, and sometimes he sells off the cows to earn more money.

Being the good father that he is, he dreams of educating his child to university despite facing a challenge of cattle theft. Fred is requesting a loan to buy cows to keep and sell after they have grown big.

loans.use: to buy cows to keep and sell after they have grown big.

loans.name: Fris

texts.en:
Fris is from Panta-on, Ozamiz City. She is 39 years old. Fris is separated and has four children. To make a living, Fris owns and operates a motorcycle transport service. Fris has engaged in her business for 10 years and earns PHP 4,000 a month for these activities. 

Fris is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 from GDMPC Microcredit, which will be used to purchase spare parts and accessories for her motorcycle. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and accessories for her motorcycle

loans.name: Monica Lucia

texts.es: Mónica reside en el sector del Fortín que pertenece a la ciudad de Guayaquil – Ecuador, inicio sus actividades con la venta de  alitas asadas, luego chuzos / choclos asados y finalmente implemento un bazar el mismo que funciona desde hace cinco años, el mismo funciona desde las 6:30 hasta las 20:00, el préstamo será destinado a la compra de cuadernos. Lapices y demás artículos escolares, el sueño que tiene Mónica para el futuro es tener un negocio mas grande que pueda generar los recursos financieros necesarios para solventar los gastos de la familia.
texts.en:
Mónica lives in the Fortín sector of the city of Guayaquil, Ecuador.  She started her business activity by selling grilled wings, then grilled meat skewers and roasted corn.  She finally set up a variety store, which she has had for five years.  She works from 6:30 a.m. until 8:00 p.m.

The loan is to buy notebooks, pencils, and other school supplies.  Mónica’s dream for the future is to have a bigger business that is able to generate the financial resources needed to pay for the family’s expenses.

loans.use: to buy variety items, especially school supplies.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia is applying for a loan of $600 (USD) to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2011 with her own working capital of $100. She earns a good income from her business.
She will use her loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as body lotion, soft drinks, beer, noodles and other items. She is a very hard-working woman and had been doing business as her regular activity for the past two years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy body lotion, soft drinks, beer, noodles and other items to sell.

loans.name: Mwenda

texts.en:
Mwenda is a married man with eight school-going children. They live at their own house that has no electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, he has operated a goat meat selling business, operating from the market where neighbours and passersby are potential customers. He faces a major challenge of seasonality and transportation in his place of operation.

With a loan of Kshs 50,000 he wants to purchase eight more goats for resale.

loans.use: to purchase eight more goats for resale.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en:
Matluba was born in a village located in the north part of Tajikistan. She is married and has four school-going children. 

She is a business woman. For 15 years she has been busy selling food products, such as candy, sugar, juice and ice-cream. 
She tries to develop her business and attain more clients. She is asking for a loan of 4000 somoni to buy food items to resell. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy food items to resell.

loans.name: Mehrigul

texts.ru: Мехригул умная и трудолюбивая девушка. Ей 22 года. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Мехригул успешно окончила среднюю школу и мечтала стать хорошей учительницей как ее учителя в школе. С такой целью она поступила в Педагогический Институт в факультет Русского языка и литературы. Она учится хорошо и отлично. Она читает произведения А. Пушкина, Л.Толстого и А. Блока. Она активно участвует в общественной жизни университета. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора за 4 курс. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mehrigul is a smart and hard working young woman.  She is 22 years old, not married, and lives with her parents.  Mehrigul successfully finished secondary school and dreams of being a great teacher, like those she had in school.  With this goal, she entered the Pedagogical Institute's School of Russian Language and Literature.  Her grades are A's and B's.  She reads works by Pushkin, Tolstoy, and Blok.  She takes an active part in the university's social life.  

Mehrigul is requesting a loan to pay her tuition for her fourth year.  She is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to pay her tuition at the Pedagogical Institute

loans.name: Asiya

texts.en: Asiya lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of one child. Her husband is a milk seller, the only source of income for the family. Her husband wants to purchase milk from a dairy farm to sell in his shop. Therefore, Asiya has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband. She is hopeful that the loan will be helpful for her husband's work. She will save the profit for the establishment of her husband's business and for its future needs. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase milk from a dairy farm to sell.

loans.name: Irene Yaqueline

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Bienestar y Progreso se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Aquí vive la señorita Irene, tiene 40 años  de edad, está soltera y  vive en casa de sus padres. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal, es la tesorera del banco  y le gusta porque son muy unidas en el grupo.

Doña Irene trabaja en una institución pública y también tiene un negocio propio,  vende ropa de todo tipo y productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Ella vende en su trabajo y en un local que tiene en su casa, mientras ella está trabajando tiene una persona encargada de atender su negocio y a quien le paga un sueldo mensual por su trabajo, deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería se la envían desde New York por lo cual sus clientes cada vez que llega mercadería le piden que les muestre sus productos. Lleva más de tres años en este negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas y productos Avon.
 
Su sueño es comprar un carro para trasladarse a su trabajo.
texts.en:
The communal bank Bienestar y Progreso (Well-being and Progress) meets every other week in Colorado of the canton Montecristi. This area is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its nationally and internationally recognized artisanship. This is also the place of origin of the famous straw hats. 

Irene, 40 years old, lives here with her parents. She is single. Irene has been with this communal bank group since its beginning and is currently the group's treasurer. She likes this group because the members are very close. Irene works in a public institution as well as in her own small business. She sells all kinds of clothing and Avon products (cosmetics, perfumes, women's accessories, and beauty products). Irene sells products in her workplace as well as from a small shop she runs from her home. While Irene is working, she hires another person to tend to her store and pays them monthly for their work. Irene allows her customers to buy products on credit and she collects payments every two days. She orders her merchandise from New York, which is why her customers ask to see her new products after each order. Irene has been running this business for three years and it has gone very well for her. 

This loan will be used to buy pants, tops, and Avon products. Irene's dream is to by a car to use to get to work.

loans.use: to buy pants, tops, and Avon products.

loans.name: Tabora Group

texts.en:
Halima, who is in her early 40s, is married with two children who are grown-ups.  

She has been running three types of businesses, she sells water from big tanks, sews bedsheets with embroidery, and buys empty plastic bottles which she sells to the plastic factories. She has been in these businesses for four years now.  She works from 6.00am to 8.00pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Halima's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase stock on all her businesses and she has paid back her loan successfully. She used the profit to cover household expenses and started building her house. She is really happy with the loan and is making a lot of progress. 

She will use this loan to buy more empty plastic bottles and also to buy broken plastic buckets to sell in the same plastic factory. She dreams of building and finishing her house.

Halima will share this loan with her loan group, Tabora Group, with ten members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more empty plastic bottles and also to buy broken plastic buckets to sell.

loans.name: Mematu

texts.en:
A married mother, Mematu is 28 years old and has one child, age 5 years. Her child is going to school. 

She runs a boutique enterprise in Jui Eastern area in Freetown. She began this business because she was a housewife, and she wanted to stop sitting at home. Instead, she wants to earn her own income. 

She has been in this business since 2007 and sells jeans, shoes, bags, and male and female clothing. She says that despite the challenges, she is a very hardworking woman and desires to become successful.

Mematu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase a variety of jeans, shoes, bags, and male and female clothing. She says that the resulting extra income will help her to increase her business and improve her status of living. 

In the future, she would like to open a fashion design shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of jeans, shoes, bags, and male and female clothing.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is married. She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking of running a bigger business, but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan and is applying for her second loan of $1,000. With the loan she will buy additional supplies to keep in her store, such as soft drinks, hard drinks, body loosen and biscuits. She is happy that TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, hard drinks, body loosen and biscuits to sell in her store.

loans.name: Amina's Group

texts.en: Amina is a 37-year-old married woman. She is a mother of four children. She adores her family. Her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband started his own business eight years ago selling welding material. Amina is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan amount to increase his supply of welding products, including iron rods, iron sheet, soldering rods, and welding rods, so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. Amina hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase iron rods, iron sheet, soldering rods, and welding rods.

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem is 48 years old and is a hardworking and diligent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband, two daughters and two sons. All  three children are studying in schools. Her husband is a laborer and his income is insufficient to pay the school fees of the children and meet the household expenses. 

Tasleem is helping her husband by selling milk, yogurt, and butter from her home to other people in suburbs. She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. The main purpose of loan is to buy milk and other dairy products from the village in large quantities and then sell it in the city on profit. 

Tasleem dreams of having her own house. With the profit amount she would pay the school fees of her children and save some money for the future. She wants to live a happy, peaceful life with her family and this loan can help fulfill her dreams. She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: To purchase dairy products

loans.name: Nelly Margot

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Bienestar y Progreso se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Nelly, tiene 53 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esta relación tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, el menor de ellos aun viven con ella.

Doña Nelly desde hace mucho tiempo atrás ha tenido que luchar sola para sacar adelante a sus hijos, tiene un negocio en su casa en el cual vende ropa de todo tipo,  pañales y  regalos. También tiene un taxi que conduce su hijo cuando él está desocupado ya que el estudia en la universidad en Manta, en este momento tiene  un chofer a quien le paga un sueldo semanal por su trabajo. Gracias a los créditos ha podido salir de situaciones muy difíciles en su vida.

Este crédito es para poder comprar ropa, pañales y pagar el arreglo del taxi. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han permitido salir adelante en momentos difíciles por lo cual esta muy agradecida. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank Bienestar y Progreso (Well-being and Progress) meets every other week in Colorado of the canton Montecristi. This area is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its nationally and internationally recognized artisanship. This is also the place of origin of the famous straw hats.

This is where Nelly (53 years old) lives. Her husband died a few years ago but she still lives with the youngest of their three children (who are now adults). For several years, Nelly has had to work by herself to help her children get ahead. She runs a business from her house, from which she sells all kinds of clothing, diapers, and gifts. Nelly also has a taxi that her son drives when he has time and is not studying in the University of Manta. Currently, Nelly pays a driver weekly for his work.

Nelly will use this loan to buy clothing, diapers, and to pay to repair her taxi. Nelly is a founding member of her communal bank group. She likes this bank because the loans have helped her to overcome some very difficult situations and she is very grateful. Her dreams are to move forward and enjoy her good health.

loans.use: to buy clothing, diapers, and to repair her taxi.

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida is a 38-year-old married woman and leader of this group. She is a mother of three children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband started his own business manufacturing furniture 14 years ago. 

Shahida is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan amount to purchase wooden boards for manufacturing furniture so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. 

Shahida hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase wooden boards for manufacturing furniture

loans.name: Abdullo

texts.ru: Абдулло 48-летний житель города Вахдат и главный кормилец семьи. У него есть жена и четверо детей. Он зарабатывает на жизнь занимаясь услугой такси. Абдулло развозит пассажиров по маршрутной линии своего города. Он занимается этим бизнесом в течение 7 лет. Абдулло получаемый доход тратит на ежедневные семейные расходы. Сейчас он хотел бы исправть технические неполадки своей машины. Поэтому он обратился за кредитом. Абдулло на сумму кредита намерен купить запасные части машины и после ремонта автомобиля продолжить свою деятельность. Абдулло ждет и надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Abdullo is 48 years old and a resident of Vahdat.  He is married and has four children and he is his family's main breadwinner.  He earns his living as a taxi driver.  Abdullo drives his passengers along a fixed route in the city.  He has been in this business for seven years.  Abdullo spends his income on his family's daily expenses.

At present, he would like to repair his car's technical problems.  For this reason, Abdullo applied for a loan.  He intends to use the loan funds to buy repair parts for his car, and continue his work once he finishes repairing it.  Abdullo is hoping for and relying on your support.

loans.use: to buy repair parts for his car

loans.name: Umeda

texts.ru: Умеде 18 лет. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Умеда с детства мечтала стать медником и в школе хорошо учила химию, биологию и физику. Она после окончания средней школы поступила в Медицинский колледж. Она является студенткой 1 курса по специальности Медицинское дело. Она учится хорошо и отлично. Умеда запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Umeda is 18 years old.  She is not married and lives with her parents.  Since her childhood, Umeda has dreamed about being a physician.  In school she was a good student of chemistry, biology, and physics.  After finishing secondary school, she entered the Medical College.  She is a first-year student specializing in medicine.  Her grades are A's and B's.

Umeda is requesting a loan to pay her tuition.  She is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en: Marlene is 48 years old and lives in Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 children. She catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan to purchase fishing materials. Marlene has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future, she hopes to have enough savings for her house renovation.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials.

loans.name: María Celeste

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Bienestar y Progreso se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 12 y 11 años que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su marido es comerciante.

Doña María realiza el crédito para ayudarle a su marido, él tiene un carro en el cual se dedica a la distribución de sodas, trabaja haciendo fletes todos los días directamente de la distribuidora mayorista a las ciudades de Montecristi y Manta, le pagan por cada flete realizado. Doña María por su parte para ganar algo propio en su casa se dedica a la venta de tarjetas y recargas telefónicas de varia operadoras, con lo cual a ella le queda algo que lo emplea en la educación de sus hijos. 

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar tarjetas, recargas telefónicas y repuestos de carro. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 2 años  y le gusta porque con los créditos ella le ayuda mucho a su esposo. 

Su sueño es darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank Bienestar y Progreso (Well-being and Progress) meets every other week in Colorado of the canton Montecristi. This area is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its nationally and internationally recognized artisanship. This is also the place of origin of the famous straw hats.

This is where María, 31 years old, lives with her husband and their two school-aged children (12 and 11 years old). Her husband is a businessman. 

María is requesting this loan to help her husband. He has a car that he uses to distribute sodas. He delivers orders directly from the wholesale distributor to the cities of Montecristi and Manta. He is paid for each delivery. María, in order to earn her own money from home, sells phone cards, cellphone minutes from various phone carriers, and car parts. Her profits from these sales help her to pay for her children's education. 

María will use this loan to buy phone cards, cellphone minutes from various phone carriers, and car parts. She has been a member of this communal bank for two years and says she likes it because the loans allow her to help her husband. María's dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy phone cards, cellphone minutes from various phone carriers, and car parts.

loans.name: Shehi

texts.en:
Shehi is a married man with ten children. They live in their own house that has no electricity or piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past 25 years, he has operated a goat meat selling business, operating from the market where neighbors and passersby are potential customers. He faces a major challenge with transportation at his place of operation.

With the Kshs 50,000 he wants to purchase 7 more goats for resale to meet the demands of his clients.

loans.use: to purchase 7 more goats for resale to meet the demands of his clients.

loans.name: Nabeela

texts.en: Nabeela is a 30-year-old responsible and hardworking housewife. She is a mother of 2 children and her husband is currently working as an auto mechanic. Nabeela and her husband have been saving money for many years to purchase a van. Her husband wants to start his own transport business. For that purpose Nabeela has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. They would purchase the van and start their own business. This could solve many of their financial problems. Nabeela is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a van.

loans.name: Tiro Group

texts.en:
Naima, who is in her early thirties, is married with two children who are still going to school.  She has been a food vendor for two years now.  She works from 6:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Naima's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to buy more stock of food to meet her customers' demand, and she has paid back her loan successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and household expenses. She is happy with the loan. Naima wants to use this loan to restock the inventory items in the food store, including rice, beans, wheat flour, sugar, and baking flour. She dreams of owning a charcoal store.

Naima will share this loan with her loan group Tiro, which has 10 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock inventory items in the food store like rice, beans, wheat flour, sugar, and baking flour.

loans.name: Fanalie

texts.en:
This is Fanalie. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more products for her direct selling business. The loan also helped in the education of her children and in their household expenditures. She has been in this business for four years now. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Fanalie hopes to be more successful in her business and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is married with 8 children. She is 65 years old and lives in Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She sells a variety of snacks to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase flour, sugar, milk and other ingredients. She has been a member of PMPC for 13 years. In the future, Rosita hopes to have more savings to use as capital in the future.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, milk and other ingredients.

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en: Samina, age 35, is the leader of this borrower group. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns a general store which is the only source of income for the family. Samina is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan, with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan amount to purchase a variety of products such as sugar, flour, wheat and pulses (dried beans like chickpeas, lentils, mung beans, etc.) for his business. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to expand his business so that he can eventually construct a small house for his family. Samina hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products such as sugar, flour, wheat and pulses (dried beans and peas) for her business.

loans.name: Ruchel Celestino

texts.en:
Ruchel Celestino, a 38-year-old married father of two from Gango, Ozamis City, earns his income from his motorcycle transport service. In business for almost four years, he makes 3,000 PHP a month.

To improve his enterprise, Ruchel Celestino is borrowing 6,000 PHP from GDMPC micro-credit, which he joined last year. He will use the loan to finance maintenance costs, and hopes to expand his business in the near future.

loans.use: to finance maintenance costs

loans.name: Babie Rose

texts.en: Babie Rose is 42 years old and single. She lives in Carmen Annex, Ozamis City. Babie Rose owns and operates a general store. She has operated her business for 6 years and earns 9,000 PHP a month from this activity. In 2008, she joined GDMPC. Babie Rose is requesting a loan of 20,800 PHP, which she will use to repair the store and buy additional goods for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair the store and buy additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Karina Mariuxi

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Bienestar y Progreso se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Karina, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  11 y 9  años y un bebé de 8 meses de nacido, los dos mayores  estudian en escuela. Su esposo tiene una fábrica de harina de pescado.

Doña Karina es una gran ama de casa que para ayudarle a su esposo realiza el crédito para que él lo emplee en su fábrica, él con ayuda de tres personas procesan el pescado y lo convierten en harina, la cual una vez procesada la va a entregar a ciertos depósitos en la ciudad de Manta lugar donde son exportadas a otros países, él tiene más de 20  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual saca adelante a su familia y genera empleo para que las personas que laboran con el también obtengan su sustento diario.

Este crédito lo va emplear para que su esposo compre pescado para elaborar la harina de pescado. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 8 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. 

Su sueño es darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Bienestar y Progreso (Wellbeing and Progress) is a Communal Bank that meets every fortnight in Colorado, Montecristi Canton, a place known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are famous both nationally and internationally; here is where the famous straw hats come from.

Here is where Karina lives. She is 32 years old, she is married and she has three children: the first two are aged 11 and 9 and go to school, while the youngest is a baby aged 8 months. He husband runs a fish meal factory.

Being a good housewife, Karina wants to help her husband and for this reason she is asking for a loan to help him invest in his factory. He works with three employees, processing fish to turn it into fish meal; once ready, he sells it to some warehouses in the town of Manta, from where it is then exported to other countries. He has been running this activity for more than 20 years, and thanks to his job he succeeds in providing for his family, and through his activity the people who work for him can earn their daily wage as well.

The loan she is requesting will be used by her husband to buy fish to produce fish meal. She has been a member of this Communal Bank for 8 years and she likes it because of the help they provide through the loans.

She dreams of providing her children with a good education.

loans.use: To buy fish.

loans.name: Lisbeth Katherine

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Bienestar y Progreso se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Lisbeth, tiene 21 años de edad, es madre soltera de una niña de 10 meses de nacida. Ella estudia Economía en la universidad en Manta y vive en casa de sus padres.
 
Lisbeth es una joven muy trabajadora que le gusta salir adelante base a su trabajo y con esto sacar adelante sola a su pequeña hija, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y zapatos por catálogos, sale a recorrer por la localidad aunque la mayor parte de sus ventas las realiza en su centro de estudios ya que allí tiene muy buenos clientes. Ella también tiene un taxi que le deja muy buenos ingresos y que lo conduce un chofer a quien le paga un sueldo por su trabajo.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa y zapatos ya que tiene varios pedidos. Lleva dos años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque así ella financia su negocio. 

Sus sueños son terminar su carrera y darle lo mejor a su hija.
texts.en:
The Bienestar y Progreso communal bank meets every two weeks in Colorado in the Montecristi canton. It is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its artisanal crafts that are known nationally and internationally. It is where the famous paja toquilla hats come from.

This is where Lisbeth comes from. She is 21 years old and is the single mother of a 10 month old girl. She studies economics at the university of Manta and lives in her parents' house.
 
Lisbeth is a hardworking young woman who likes to get ahead based on her own hard work, and that way get her little daughter ahead by herself. She is a merchant who sells clothes and shoes via catalog. She goes out in the community, although most of her sales are made where she goes to school, since she has very good customers there. She also has a taxi that brings in good income. It has a driver whom she pays a salary for his work. 

This loan is to buy clothes and shoes, since she has a lot of orders. She has been in the communal bank for two years and she likes it because that is how she finances her business.   

Her dream is to finish her major and give her daughter the best.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Nguwa

texts.en:
Nguwa has operated a meat goat selling business, selling his goats from the market where neighbors and passersby are potential customers. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his place of operation.

With the Kshs 50,000 he wants to purchase more goats for resale and he appreciates the support granted.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for resale.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: A $1,000 loan has been offered to Veronica to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee and a refrigerator to keep drinks cold. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2010. She feels comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee and a refrigerator to keep drinks cold.

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan is 46 years old. He lives in the Martvili District with his wife, son and mother, who is provided with a retirement pension. Levan requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a milk cow, whose milk is used to make cheese products. Besides that, they have 100 nut trees and 0.3 hectare of agricultural land where maize is grown. They sell cheese, nuts and maize locally at a good price. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Levan requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Levan has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit, Levan will begin trading in cement. He will purchase a big stock of cement and then resell at a higher price. This will increase the income of his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to begin trade with cement

loans.name: Waheeda

texts.en:
