Waheeda, 38, is the responsible mother of 3 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband and children. Her husband is janitor in a hospital, but his salary is not enough to meet the household expenses. He wants to start his own business. 

Waheeda has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. With this loan, her husband will purchase a rickshaw, and he will drive the rickshaw at night while doing his current job during the day. In this way, his monthly income will increase, and the family will be able to send their children to school.

Waheeda is very hopeful for this loan and she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a rickshaw.

loans.name: Marselina

texts.en: Marselina is requesting a 600 USD loan to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to shop every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee and a refrigerator in which to keep drinks. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2013. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee and a refrigerator in which to keep drinks.

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel is a married woman who has two children. She is 38 years old and resides in Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. Richel has a farm, and she's been in this business for years. Each month, she earns about 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP). Aside from this, she also manages a service-based business, providing motor transport and rentals. 

She is now requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy a new motorcycle to be used for transportation services. In the future, Richel wants to build a house and to finance the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle for transportation services.

loans.name: Zani

texts.en:
Zani has operated a goat meat selling business, operating from the market where passersby are potential customers. He faces the major challenge of transportation to his place of operation.

With this loan of 20,000 KES, he wants to purchase 4 goats to resell to his customers. He appreciates the help.

loans.use: to purchase 4 goats to resell to his customers.

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan is 41 years old. He lives in the Zestaponi District with his wife, three children and parents, who receive a retirement pension. Levan has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for his family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time, because of his low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

Levan works as a distributor at a local company and earns a monthly salary. This is the only source of income for their family. It is hardly enough for cover food for the family. According to Credo's estimate the family belongs in the "subsistence poor" category. 

Levan has requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-ups and re-startups credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the credit Levan will purchase a stock of groceries. As the groceries are purchased, he will renovate a space near his house and open a grocery store. This will increase the income of his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of groceries and open a grocery store.

loans.name: Elham Group

texts.en: This group is called Elham. It consists of four women who live in Taiz, Yemen. They took out a loan of 100,000 YER. Samah is the president of this group. She is a 23-year-old married woman with one child. She is a housewife and has a small house. She requires a youth loan of 25,000 YER from AMB in order to buy construction supplies to renovate her house. She hopes to expand her house and open a savings account in AMB.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to renovate her house.

loans.name: Latofat

texts.en:
Latofat is 37 years old, and she is a hardworking woman with a great desire to progress in life. Her life partner is a driver. They have one non-adult child. The family lives in a house that Latofat's husband built. 
Latofat is one of the successful business women in her town. For more than seven years, she has been busy selling different kinds of fabric. She knows all aspects of her business very well. Her experiences and skills have helped her to develop the business and improve her living conditions. She manages the business alone. Latofat wants to continue to develop  her business, but her income is small and she needs your help and mercy.
This is the sixth loan she has requested from IMON. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 TJS to buy fabric for the new season. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy fabric for the new season.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is a farmer from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. He is a married man and has been in the business for several years now. This is the source of his income. 

Antonio is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, he will be able to improve his farm as well as his harvest. In the future, Antonio dreams of making his business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
This is Avelina. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories for the maintenance of their jeepney unit. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenses.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy additional spare parts for the maintenance of their jeepney unit. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this increase in earnings with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Avelina dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship** members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

*Curiously, Jeepney has purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw out the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepney is one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

**All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Loynie

texts.en: Loynie is a single young entrepreneur who works as store attendant and also operates her own sari-sari store in her home at Doña Consuelo, Ozamis City. During her free time and weekends, she personally assists and manages her store. When she's on duty, her mother, with whom she stays, watches over her store. As a new member of GDMPC, she borrowed a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy inventory for her sari-sari store. She always works hard and manages her business properly in order to generate income so that she can renovate her home to live a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida is a 27-year-old hardworking and diligent woman. Her husband has been running a butcher shop for ten years. He sells fresh meat; his clients are very satisfied with his services and thus his customer base is growing. Currently he wants to renovate his butcher shop to attract more customers. He would like to build one more room in his shop to add more space as the current space is too congested. For that purpose Sajida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. As this business is the only source of income for her family, this loan is very important to them. Sajida would spend the profit on the education of her children and would make them good, responsible citizens of Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Sadaf

texts.en: Sadaf is a 26-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse. Since 2009, her husband has been running a small vegetable shop. This is the only source of income for their family. Due to the increase in the demand of the customers, Sadaf has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for the expansion of her husband's shop. With the loan investment, her husband can buy a variety of fresh vegetables that will allow him to offer more varieties to his clients and increase his sales and income. He would also build one more room to add some more space to his shop. Her husband is a very hardworking and honest man and is confident about his family’s bright future.

loans.use: To purchase fresh vegetables

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 49-year-old married father of four children. He owns a small business where he paints furniture and decorates it, and has been working in this field since 1995. His wife is currently unemployed, rendering him to be the only financial provider of the family. Two of his children are enrolled in private schools, which means that he has to settle the schooling tuition fees on top of all the other heavy expenses. 

He decided to contact Al Majmoua because it was his only hope to enhance his business and increase his revenue. In fact, he will be purchasing a compressor, a work kit, paint, and raw material that would help him expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase a compressor, a work kit, paint, and raw material that would help him expand his business.

loans.name: Antolin

texts.es:
Antolin continúa viviendo en la ciudad de Huancarani y continua con la tienda de costura ósea tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio. (Huancarani, Paucartambo, Cusco) donde confecciona ropa y también hace compostura como por ejemplo subida de basta, entallado y cambio de sierre. 

En esta oportunidad Antolin requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo cierres, hilos y agujas.  

Antolin continúa en el banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Antolin continues to live in the the city of Huarancarani and continues with his small sewing shop, which he has in his home (in Huancarani, Paucartambo, Cusco). This is where Antolin makes clothing and also does mending and repairs, such as alterations of length or waist, as well as changing zippers. 

On this occasion, Antolin needs a loan to buy more work materials, for example zippers, thread and needles. 

Antolin continues with the community bank "Mamacha Rosario" of Asociación Arariwa. He is very grateful for the opportunity provided him through these means and he is committed to completing his payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials like zippers, thread, and needles.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
This is Josefina. Her previous loan was a big help in her business as well as in her household expenditures. She has been in this business for ten years now. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their family's everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 33,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy gardening materials like wire and baskets and supplies such as seed and fertilizer. Her profits from this business will definitely help her sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Josefina hopes that she will continue to be successful in her business and dreams of having strength to serve God. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy gardening materials like wire and baskets and supplies such as seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jennelyn

texts.en:
This is Jennelyn. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more products for her variety store. The loan also helped with her household expenditures, especially with her children's education. She has been in this business for four years now. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and the children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jennelyn hopes to continue her business and dreams of having a good future. She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business, and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Maradi

texts.en:
Maradi buys and sells goats at the market. He has been in this business for the past ten years.  Thanks to God, he has good clients, due to his character and the way he attends to his customers.
With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase six goats for resale to his customers.

loans.use: to purchase six goats for resale.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina is a 44-year-old married mother of two children. She is employed in a center for handicapped children and has taken care of their mental and educational development since five years ago. Though her income is low, and her work requires a lot of patience and perseverance, she is devoted to her job. Her husband works in the sales department of a store. Both her children are enrolled in private schools, which means that she and her husband have to pay tuition. She decided to contact Al Majmoua for a second time in a row because she needs financial support to maintain her house's bathroom. She cannot afford to do it with her own salary. In the future, Lina wishes to open her own center just like the one she works in so that she can provide the best care and education to disabled children.

loans.use: to maintain her house's bathroom.

loans.name: Chidunga

texts.en:
Chidunga is a married man with five children who are in school. They live in their own house, which has no electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 15 years, he has operated a goat meat selling business, operating from the market where neighbors and passersby are potential customers. He faces the challenge of lost sheep in his place of operation.

With this loan of 40,000 KES, he wants to purchase more goats to resell to his customers to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats to resell.

loans.name: Jani

texts.en:
Jani is a 35-year-old hardworking and talented furniture-maker who is self-trained. He started practicing such skills about five years back, and the more he practiced, the more he learned about how to make greater and better things. “Just like they say,” he said, “that knowledge is the treasure, and practice is the key to it,” he continued, smiling. 

Jani is married and has two children, five and three years old, and all of them live in a little town of approximately 10,000 inhabitants in south-central Albania. The shop where he works is small according to him, but he plans that in the near future, he will replace it with a bigger one where he can work comfortably. 

Yet, for now his goal is to invest in buying raw wooden material that he needs to produce furniture. The loan that Jani is requesting from Kiva lenders will help him achieve this immediate goal.

loans.use: to buy raw wooden material for his furniture-making shop.

loans.name: Jenie

texts.en:
Jenie is 41 years old. She is married and has three children. She lives in Mauswagon, Calamba. 

To make a living, Jenie grows rice as her business. She has been doing this for five years, earning a monthly income of PHP 3,600. 

Jenie has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fertilizer for her rice field business. She has been a member of Paglaum MPC since 2005.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her rice field business.

loans.name: Najla

texts.en: Najla is a 38-year-old married woman from Lebanon living with her husband and six children, some of whom are still attending school. With great effort, Najla started a business selling clothing with the small amount she had saved earlier. She has spent two years selling clothing, and all is going well because of her friendly personality towards clients and the high quality products she offers at low prices. Today, she is seeking a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to buy more merchandise for her business, such as pants, shirts, sandals, etc. This will allow her to offer a greater variety of products and thus improve her income. She works very hard every day so as to make her greatest dream, to have a bigger business, become a reality.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her business

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 68 years old and lives in Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with five children. 

Luzminda has a pottery business and earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to pay for crafts materials. 

Luzminda has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, she hopes to have enough savings for her family’s future.

loans.use: to purchase crafts materials.

location.town: Plaridel - Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Reynante

texts.en:
Reynante is 31 years old and lives in Lamao, Liloy, Zambonaga del Norte. He is married.

Reynante is a motorcycle driver as his business and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan to purchase equipment for his motorcycle business.

Reynante is a new member of PMPC. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for his motorcycle business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is widow, 63 years old, and has five adult children. She lives in Yahong Tudela, Misamis Occidental. Her children live separately with their own families. 

To make a living, she owns and operates a service-based business, providing motor rental and transportation in the local community. 

Victoria has requested a loan of PHP 3,500 from GDMPC Microcredit to buy a raincoat, helmet and other motorcycle accessories in order to improve the services she provides. She plans to save a portion of her income to be engaged in another line of business.

loans.use: to buy a raincoat, helmet and other motorcycle accessories.

loans.name: Melania

texts.en:
This is Melania. Her previous loan helped her a lot in her business as she was able to buy more needed materials. The loan also helped in her family's expenditure as well as in her child's education. She is already six years into this business. She and her husband work hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and child’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Melania dreams to expand and have more sewing machines. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials like fabric, thread, and other materials needed in her business

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo has operated a retail shop business for the past 4 years, selling household consumables like wheat flour and maize flour from her home to her neighbors. She faces the challenge of the high cost of transportation, but she dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With this loan of 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil to resell.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil to resell.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is 41-year-old housewife with many dreams to fulfill. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her family. Her husband is a welder.

Khalida has requested a loan amount of 20,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She is taking the loan for her husband to buy welding material such as iron rods, welding rods, soldering rods, iron sheets, etc. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her husband's business. She will use the profit for household expenses. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase welding material

loans.name: Cilh Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 35-year-old Consolata Sukai from Masvingo. She is a single parent with two children and both are attending school.  

Consolata runs a food business selling beef, sausages, pork and fish. The business has been in operation for 5 years. She says the main challenge being faced is that of high transport costs of ferrying cattle from Chivhu to Save where her business is situated.

Consolata has requested a loan of $600 to purchase beef and fish for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her an increase in disposable income and, hence, allow her to pay fees for her children. In the future, Consolata plans to venture into a grocery and bottle store business.

loans.use: to purchase fish and beef

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has five children, all in school. She owns a house that has no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a fish selling business at the market for the past two years, selling to her town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of purchasing fish, especially during cold currents in the deep sea. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans at a lower cost to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood

loans.name: Cindy Vanessa

texts.es: Cindy Vanessa es una mujer de 25 años de edad, madre de un hijo de 5 años. Hace un año por influencia de una amiga, comenzó a involucrarse con la actividad de ventas de mercancía por catálogo de Amway y realizando la entrega de los productos a domicilio, con lo cual ha podido generar ingresos para su familia y para el sostenimiento de su pequeño hijo. Es una joven juiciosa y trabajadora. El crédito que solicita lo desea invertir en la compra de surtido de dichos productos (cremas corporales, lociones, productos de aseo) y, de esta manera poder ofrecer más variedad de mercancía a sus clientes, con lo cual podrá aumentar sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos. Su mayor sueño es tener un negocio más grande y sólido, que le permita seguir ayudando a su familia, compartir más tiempo con su hijo y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cindy Vanessa is a 25-year-old mother of a five-year-old son. A year ago, with her friend's influence, she began to get involved with selling merchandise from Amway catalogs, delivering the products to homes,  which is how she has been able to generate an income for her family and to support her small child. She is a wise and hard-working woman. 

She hopes to invest the loan she is requesting in the purchase of an assortment of products (body cream, lotion, cleaning products) and, in that way, she will be able to offer her clients a larger variety of merchandise, with which she can increase her sales and therefore her income. 

Her biggest wish is to have a bigger and more solid business, which will allow her to continue helping her family, share more time with her son and offer him a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of merchandise (body cream, lotion, cleaning products)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase shaving machines, ointments, shaving gels and other items

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
This is Eduardo. His previous loan was a big help in his business. It also helped in his family's expenditures. He has been in this business for four years now. He, together with his wife, works hard to provide for their everyday expenses.

He would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for him to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Eduardo dreams to have more tricycles and good drivers. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week. He also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of his tricycle unit

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a widow and is 62 years old. She lives in Canibungan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Teresita owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 15 years and earns PHP 5,000 each month. 

Teresita is requesting a loan of PHP 7,200 to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Teresita has been a member of GDMPC for three years. Teresita plans to save her returns in order to buy a new house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour and maize flour from home to her neighbours. She faces the challenge of lack of enough capital to expand her business. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Lefterije

texts.en:
Lefterije is 52 and has six children with some of them still attending public school. This will be her third time applying for a loan and she will use it to stock up on inventory items for the store that she has been operating for two years.

“It has been going good so far, thanks God,” she said. “We live in a rural village and the store is located here, so the sales and income are somehow limited, but still we’re doing just fine. In addition to this, we have some other agricultural activities going on. Living in a village, agriculture is the most preferred type of activity for almost everyone, because we got the land to use it and also the geographical locations supports livestock. So in a way we see this as a blessing,” she ended.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her store

loans.name: Asifa

texts.en: Asifa is a 40-year-old hardworking and diligent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a barber shop for three years. Due to the increase in the number of customers, her husband wants to expand his business. For that purpose, Asifa has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. Her husband would purchase some new chairs for his shop. He will also buy some items like a shaving machine, creams, a dryer, blades etc. This will increase his earnings and net income. Asifa is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC.

loans.use: To purchase chairs and other items for her husband's barber shop

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is a married woman and a mother of seven adult children from Trinidad, Bohol. She has been a farmer for more than 10 years now. She also raises hogs. 
Carmencita is asking for a loan to buy feed for her pigs and fertilizer for her farm. With this, she will be able to improve her business and augment her income. Carmencita hopes to expand her business in the future so that it will generate more income.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Rayzen

texts.en: Rayzen is an 18-year-old student in one of the universities in Ozamiz City. She lives in Kinangay Sur, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Her father is a farmer. This year, she needs financial assistance since her parents were not able to provide the school obligations this year. She joined GDMPC and is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP in order to pay her tuition. She positively hopes to finish her studies and be able to find a job in the near future.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Samina is a 36-year-old hardworking and diligent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along with her husband and five children. Her husband has been running a business selling gemstones for four years. He has a shop in the main market of the city. Samina has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. With the loan, her husband wants to purchase a new variety of rare gemstones. This will attract more customers and his sales will increase. After getting the profit, Samina will pay the installments of the loan and save some money for the marriage of her children.

loans.use: To purchase rare gemstones

loans.name: Susan's Group

texts.en:
Susan's group is comprised of four hardworking women. Susan is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. For the past two years, Susan has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, milk, and bread. 

To help expand her business, Susan has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items such as milk, soup and bread for the store to sell. This will help Susan to generate greater profits and boost her business. Susan hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a bicycle. 

Susan is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as milk, soup and bread for the store to sell.

loans.name: Burihol

texts.ru: Бурихол 50-летняя замужняя женщина. У нее четверо детей. Бурихол вместе семьей живет в районе Джиликуль. У нее среднее образование. Она добрая и порядочная женщина. Бурихол вот уже 6 лет как занимается двумя видами деятельности одновременно: земледелием и садоводством. Ее семья тоже работает в сельском  хозяйстве. Таким образом, они вместе зарабатывают на жизнь. Бурихол арендует участок земли, на котором выращивает овощи, в основном морковь. Она запрашивает кредит для закупа топлива и минерального удобрения, чтобы провести процесс обработки земли, а остальную часть суммы заплатить за аренду земли. В будущем Бурихол планирует приобрести землю и расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Burihol is a 50 year-old married woman.  She has four children.  Burihol and her family live in the Jilikul district.  She has a secondary education.  She is a kind and decent woman.  Burihol has been involved in two types of business concurrently: farming and gardening.  Her family also works in agriculture.  Thus, they earn a living together.  Burihol leases a plot of land, where she grows vegetables, primarily carrots.  She is requesting this loan to purchase fuel and mineral fertilizers in order to treat the land, and want to use the rest of the sum to pay for the land lease.  In the future, Burihol plans to buy land and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and mineral fertilizers and to pay for the land lease

loans.name: Marylin Esther

texts.es: Marylin es una empresaria jovial emprendedora, es casada, con dos hijos, su negocio es tener una panadería desde hace 8 años, ella elabora pan simple, reposterías, barras de pan etc. trabajan con ella dos personas que le paga salarios, el objetivo de este préstamo es para la compra de materia prima como harina, manteca, levaduras, azúcar, rodamina, canela, queso, sal, leña, aceite, atados de dulces etc.
texts.en:
Marylin is a jovial and enterprising business owner.  She's married and has two children.

Her business is a bakery she has had for eight years.  She makes loaves of bread, pastry, baguettes, etc.  She pays salaries to two people who work with her.

The goal of this loan is to buy ingredients such as flour, shortening, leavening, sugar, coloring, cinnamon, cheese, salt, firewood, oil, packaged sweets, etc.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Juliet's Group

texts.en:
Juliet's group is comprised of 3 hard-working women. Juliet is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kyejojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Juliet has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, milk, and bread. 

To help expand her business, Juliet has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items, such as milk, soup and bread, for the store to sell and will help Juliet to generate greater profits and improve her family's stardand of living. Juliet hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a motorcycle. 

Juliet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to purchase more items for the store to sell, such as milk, soup and bread

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a married woman. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food. 

For the past several years, she has operated a food kiosk business, selling food maize flour and cooking fat to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge but she dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Barno

texts.ru: Женщина, которая является хранительницей очага своего дома и опорой для своих детей, имеет грандиозную идею, организовать новый бизнес. Барно много лет жила бедно, так как ее муж трудовой мигрант и имеет маленькую зарплату и не в состоянии обеспечить своих 2 детей со всеми не обходимыми средствами. Дети год за годом требуют больше благ, так как они развеваются вместе с развевающимся миром. Она решила организовать бизнес шитьём занавесок. Она долго искала помощь и наконец, она узнала о курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованной Ассоциация Деловых Женщин. Она участвовала на этом курсе и получила много позитива для себя. После завершения курса она получила сертификат. Теперь она готова начать бизнес, однако она не имеет денег, чтобы купить ткани для шитья занавесок. Она будет шить занавески, и продавать их, а также она будет шить занавески по заказу. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 700 сомони для покупки ткани. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: The woman, who is the guardian of her house hearth and support for her children, has a grand idea to organize a new business.  Barno has been living very poorly for many years because her husband is a migrant worker and has a small salary, and cannot provide his two children with all the necessities.  The children require more comforts year-after-year because they develop with the developing world.  Barno decided to organize a business of sewing curtains.  She searched for help for a long time and finally learned about the "Achieve Success" course, organized by the Association for Business Women.  She participated in this course and obtained a lot of positives for herself.  She obtained a certificate upon completing the course.  Now, she is ready to start the business, but does not have money to buy fabric for sewing curtains.  She will sew curtains and sell them and will also sew curtains to-order.  Barno is requesting a loan in the amount of 700 somoni to purchase fabric.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and start her new business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 32-year-old married woman with two children and supports a family of four. She buys and sells fruits and vegetable in Kericho. This has been her source of income for the last two years.

Elizabeth gets an average monthly income of KES 20,000. 

She has borrowed KES 30,000 from KADET LTD. with which she intends to purchase more stock of fruits, vegetables and other food stuff like potatoes and green maize to boost her sales. Elizabeth's profits will help her boost her business as well as venture into a clothing business.

Elizabeth hopes to improve her living standards as well as become financially stable; she also hopes to save enough money to enable her to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Siham

texts.en: Siham is an 18-year-old married lady. Her husband is 2 years older and is a private sector employee. Her friends used to come to ask her to do their makeup, so she decided to start a small beauty business at home. Therefore, she applied for a youth loan so she can get new makeup tools, makeup products, a new hair dryer and brushes to start the business.

loans.use: to buy new makeup tools, makeup products, a new hair dryer and brushes to start the business.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en: Faten is a conservative married lady. She asked her husband, for whom she is applying, to take her place in the photo. Faten is a housewife who looks after their house. Her husband, Mahmoud, sells different types of cigarettes from a portable kiosk. She applied for this loan to acquire more types of tobacco and lighters to sell and increase their family’s income.

loans.use: to buy more types of tobacco and lighters to sell

loans.name: Gina Patricia

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Bienestar y Progreso se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Gina, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de  10 años que  estudian en escuela. Su esposo tiene una fábrica de harina de pescado.

Doña Gina es una gran ama de casa que para ayudarle a su esposo realiza el crédito para que él lo emplee en su fábrica, él con ayuda de varias  personas procesan el pescado y lo convierten en harina, la cual una vez procesada la va a entregar a ciertos depósitos en la ciudad de Manta lugar donde son exportadas a otros países. Ella por su parte se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, la misma que vende tanto en su casa como por su localidad, ella lleva dos años con su negocio y su esposo mucho más tiempo.

Este crédito lo va emplear para que su esposo compre pescado para elaborar la harina de pescado. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 2 años y le gusta por con el crédito empezó su negocio. 

Su sueño es darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The Bienestar y Progreso (Well-Being and Progress) communal bank meets every two weeks in Colorado in the canton of Montecristi, known for its rich precolonial culture and for its handcrafts that are recognized at a national and international level. It is the home of the famous Panama hats.

Gina, 37 years old, lives here. She is married and she and her husband have a 10-year-old son who goes to school. Her husband has a fish meal factory.

Gina is a great housewife who is taking out the loan in order to help her husband so that he can use it in his factory. With the help of several people, he processes the fish and turns it into meal. Once processed, it will be delivered to certain warehouses in the city of Manta, where it is exported to other countries. For her part, Gina sells clothing of all kinds, both in her home and at her shop. She has had her business for two years and her husband has had his for much longer.

This loan is for her husband to buy fish to make the fish meal. She has been in the communal bank for 2 years, and she likes it because she started her business with the loan. 

Her dream is to give her son the best.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John supplies water in Tala town and has been in this business for 16 years. He also sells health products, such as aloe vera soaps and detergents. He is 45 years old, married and has 5 children. 

This is his fourth loan term with KADET LTD, and he plans to use the amount to buy more stock of bottled water for resale to retail traders and various hotels in the area. He will use the generated income to pay school fees for his children.

John hopes to grow his business and be successful in the water supply business.

loans.use: To buy more stock of bottled water to resell.

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en:
Ammar is 29 years old and lives in Sana'a, Yemen. He is a hardworking man who strives to offer his family a good life. He has been operating a home appliances business for one and a half years. He started his business from his personal capital. It is the main source of his income. Many people prefer his store because he always has the basic staples at accessible prices, and he provides the best possible customer service. 

His dream is to see his store flourish. Due to the current, bad situation in Yemen, he has less profit from his enterprise. So, he took a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to stock his business with more products of home appliances so that his customers will always find what they need and keep coming back.

loans.use: to buy home appliances for his business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a widowed lady, aged 51 years old, with four children.  She sells smoked fish in different markets in and around Kagadi, and it is from this business that she is able to take care of her children since 2008 when her husband passed away.  She acquired a loan of 500,000 UGX previously to grow her business and because of this loan, Mary was able to realize increased profits.

Mary now wants another loan of 600,000 UGX to buy more fish to sell and meet the ever-increasing demand for it. She is a hardworking person who is only challenged by the limited capital for her business and the poor road network.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell

loans.name: Salem

texts.en:
Salem is a 38 year-old married father of three children. Everyday, he rides his small truck from one village to another transporting and selling fruits and vegetables to villagers and farmers. His wife sells beauty cosmetics and clothes in their neighborhood. Their children are enrolled in public schools, in order to get a better education than their parents. 

Salem contacted Kiva partner Al Majmoua because he needs to register his small truck in the state's records, and does not have enough money to do so. As for the future, he wishes to purchase a new truck that could fit even more merchandise.

loans.use: to register his small truck in the state's records.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 35 years old. She lives in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia with her husband. Mariam requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time, because of low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

Mariam trades used clothing. This is the only source of income for their family. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Mariam requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Mariam has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, Mariam will purchase a car and rent it out. This will increase the income of their family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a car and rent it out

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina lives in the village of Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamid Occidental. She is 48 years old. She has been engaged in farming and agriculture for many years. 

Agustina has a farm, and she plants rice for family consumption and sells a portion of it for their basic needs. She borrowed a loan of 7,000 from GDMPC micro credit to purchase fertilizer. She plans to expand her farm in order to generate more income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Bienestar y Progreso se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 55 años de edad, es madre soletera  tiene cuatro hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven con ella.

Doña Ana para salir adelante junto a sus hijos desde hace muchos años se dedica a la distribución de agua, tiene un tanquero y uno de sus hijos se encarga de realizar los viajes hasta la ciudad de Manta a entregar en algunas fabricas de esta ciudad, también entrega agua a domicilio en la ciudad de Montecristi. Es así como desde hace muchos años ella saca adelante a su familia.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar combustibles y repuestos para el tanquero. Está en el Banco Comunal hace más de 8 años y está muy agradecida ya que con los créditos ella ha podido sacar adelante a su familia. 

Su sueño es tener buena salud.
texts.en: The Bienestar y Progreso community bank meets every 15 days in Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, known for its rich precolonial culture and handicrafts which are nationally and internationally known. It is the place of the famous straw hats. 55 year old Ana lives here, a single mother of four grown children, two of whom still live with her. In order to make a living together with her children, many years ago she began distributing water. She has a tank and one of her children is in charge of making the trips to Manta city to deliver to some of the factories in the city as well as make home deliveries in Montecristi city. This is how she supported her family for many years. This loan is going to be used to buy fuel and spare parts for the tank. She has been a member of the communal bank for more than 8 years and she is very thankful because the loans have enabled her to support her family. Her dream is to have good health.

loans.use: to buy fuel and spare parts for the water tank.

loans.name: Kebeh

texts.en:
Kebeh is 34 years old. She is married and lives in Gbarnga in Liberia. Gbarnga is located in the center of Liberia in Bong County. The majority of people are employed as farmers, cultivating crops such as rice, palm oil and cassava.  

She has had a table business for the past four years, selling fish. She works at her business for 10 hours a day. She transports her goods to her business by bus. The biggest challenge she faces in her business is few goods on her table. She did not go to school. Her husband is a teacher. She has three children between 13 and 8 years old who live at home and are in school.  

With the proceeds from the loan, she wants to get more fish. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. She started her business with money from her mother. In the future, she wants to own a house. She is proud of her business because she gets money every day for her expenses.
  
She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to get more fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish, oil, rice, pepper, vita, onions, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard, 45, is married with six children, of which four are in school. Richard makes bricks for a living, and has been doing this job since 2001 to support the family. Richard got a loan of.800,000 UGX to buy a cow for milking. Some of the milk is sold to bring in additional income to the family.

Richard has approached Ugafode to get another loan of 1,000,000 UGX to buy another cow for milking to increase his income base. His dream is to expand his land so that he can have more cows grazing, increasing his income substantially. 

However, he is limited by his funds, for he has to meet the needs of his children who are attending school. He is, however, a hardworking man.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Servet

texts.en:
Servet is a masonry worker who gained his skills while an immigrant in Greece. He has been working in the field for fifteen years and at the same time he has been operating a little livestock business in the rural village where he and his family reside.  

“Fortunately there have been plenty of houses being built the latest years in our region and of course there is a high demand for my masonry skills. Yet, this is on-call work, so in an attempt to supplement our family’s income, I started with my wife the livestock. Mainly, we sell dairy to the local market; milk, cheese and cottage cheese are some of the produce we sell,” said Servet.

Servet wants to buy a dairy cow, and he is very appreciative for the opportunity to be financed by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en: Bassam is a 41-year-old Lebanese man, he is married and living with his wife and four children. His wife works in a local school in order to supplement the family’s earnings. As for Bassam, he is the main source of income and has worked hard in the construction field for the past 13 years. Over these years, Bassam was able to build a good business reputation as well as hiring two part time employees to help him accomplish the tough tasks. Today, he is requesting to borrow from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase metal scaffolding so as to carry out his work properly. In the future, Bassam looks forward to opening a small construction office where he will distribute jobs to construction entrepreneurs to expand his work and become an expert at his job.

loans.use: to purchase metal scaffolding

loans.name: Khuzhakul

texts.en:
Khuzhakul is 38-years-old. He and his wife are industrious people and have five children. He is very hardworking and kind-natured.

Khuzhakul has been farming for 15 years, producing wheat, rice and corn. He has been in this line of work since he was a boy, so all of his experience has been dedicated to producing crops. His products are sold at the local market in the city. He has additional income from animal husbandry. Currently he has eight cows and 20 sheep. 

In order to provide his crops with needed attention, Khuzhakul is currently requesting a loan so that he can buy fertilizer to continue improving his crop production and also to buy cattle to increase the number of cattle. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and cattle.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
This is Marina. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy the spare parts she needed. The loan also helped in her family's everyday expenditures. She has had this business for seven years now. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday expenses. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP (Philippine pesos) loan for her to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marina hopes to have more tricycles. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Edita Cecilia

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Bienestar y Progreso se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Edita, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  11 y 7 años que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Doña Edita tiene una tienda en su casa,  allí vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde. Ella invierte parte del crédito en el negocio de su esposo el cual tiene un tanquero y todos los días realiza viajes hasta la ciudad de Manta lugar donde entrega este líquido vital en varias empresas de esta ciudad. Ella tiene 4 años con su tienda la misma que le permite ganarse algo por su cuenta y estar al tanto de las necesidades de sus pequeños.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar víveres para su tienda y combustibles y repuestos para el tanquero de su esposo. Está en el Banco Comunal hace más de 4 años y le gusta por la unión del grupo. 

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Bienestar y Progreso” (Well-being and Progress) meets every fifteen days in Colorado in the Montecristi Cantón, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts that are recognized at the national and international level—it's the place of the famous straw hats.

Edita lives here.  She is 34 years old, married and from this relationship they have two children, 11 and 7 years old, who go to school.  Her husband is a merchant.  Edita has a store in her home.  There she sells all kinds of products like rice, sugar, oils, detergents, legumes, vegetables and fruits.  She works every day from 6am to 8pm and sometimes even later.  She will invest part of the loan in the business of her husband who has a tanker and every day makes trips to the city of Manta, the place where he delivers vital liquid to several businesses in this city.  She has 4 years with her same store and that permits her to earn something of her own and to be up to date with the needs of her children.

She is going to use this loan to purchase provisions for her store and fuel and spare parts for her husband's tanker.  She has been in the communal bank for more than four years and she likes it for the unity of the group. 

Her goals are to move forward with her business and grow her store more each day.

loans.use: to buy provisions, fuel and spare parts.

loans.name: Natia

texts.en:
Natia is 33 years old. She lives in the small village of Lanchkhuti District with her husband, 11-year-old son and pensioner father-in-law. Natia requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Natia runs a pharmacy in her village. This is the only source of income for her family. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Natia requested a loan from Credo to startup a family business. Natia has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit, Natia will purchase a stock of additional products such as hygiene items and baby food. As the pharmacy is expanded, the income is increased. Part of the profit will be reinvested in the same business. With another part, she will be able to provide wellbeing for her family members. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products and expand the pharmacy.

loans.name: Gorpu

texts.en:
Gorpu, a 28-year-old business woman from Liberia, is married and has two children, one four years old and attending school, and one nine months old. Gorpu completed grade eight before starting her business. She describes herself as hardworking.

Gorpu lives and works in Gbarnga, the capital City of Bong County, an agricultural hub located in the centre of the country. The majority of residents are farmers growing rice, palm oil and cassava.

For the past five years Gorpu has been selling roasted fish and fried plantains, working from 4 p.m. to 10 p.m. everyday. Her greatest challenge is limited capital. She intends to use this loan to buy more snapper, plantain and oil for her business.

Gorpu hopes to one day own a house. She wants to thank Kiva lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to buy more snapper, plantain and oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more oil, pepper, vita, onions, etc.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a 64-year-old conservative woman. She asked her son to take her place in the photo instead. 

Nadia is married to a mechanic. They have three sons and one daughter. Nadia and her son Alaa, 22 years old, who appears in the photo, work as hairstylists. Nadia does this work at home, and her son works in his shop. She has applied for this loan today to buy new hair dryers, new brushes and other tools.

loans.use: to buy new hair dryers, new brushes and other tools.

loans.name: Saif

texts.en: Saif is 24 years old. He runs a small store where he sells grocery items to the people in his area. From this, he earns a small amount, which is not enough for subsistance. His family assisted him to establish his business. He is a single man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He aims to increase his profits, but has had inadequate funds to invest in his business. Now he is asking for a loan of 150,000 YER. This will be used to buy canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, and soap to sell in his store. He hopes to have a car to facilitate carrying his goods to his store from the market.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, and soap to sell in his store.

loans.name: Nalis

texts.en:
Nalisi is aged 57 years. He is married with three children who stay with him, plus two orphans who are his grandchildren. Nalisi operates a local gin trade business, and it has been his major source of income since 1988. He has additional income from the salary earned as a teacher.

Nalisi has approached Ugafode to get a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings to buy a wooden door for his building to shut it from thieves and animals. Nalisi plans to use one of the rooms for his family to stay in and one for renting so that he can increase his income.

Nalisi is a hardworking person who wants to see that the family gets a decent living standard, but he is only constrained by the small income that limits the amount of loan to be taken.

loans.use: To buy a door for his house.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 37-year-old married man with five children and all attend school.  He is a farmer mainly growing matooke for home and commercial purposes.  He also grows some coffee and maize if the season is on.

David has been practicing agriculture since 1998 after failing to continue with education because of a lack of tuition having been born in a large family.

David wants a loan of ugx.1,500,000/=(one million and five hundred thousand shillings) in order to expand his banana plantation as well as clearing bush to prepare for planting maize for next season.  His dream is to become a commercial producer for agricultural products as a way of earning more from his projects.

However, David is always challenged by inconsistencies in changing weather conditions that affect agriculture as well as the price fluctuations of the agricultural products on the market.

loans.use: to buy mulches for his banana plantation.

loans.name: Sidney

texts.en:
Sidney is a young man, who has beaten all of the odds to build his own small rental houses in one of the city suburbs, and he recalls that it was all from very hard work and being focused. He has a family and dependants too. This has left him without satisfying most of his customers, because the range of products he deals in is limited by the amount of his capital.

He now wants a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to boost his small business, which is strategically located in the city center, in order to provide a variety of products to his customers. 

He believes that with this small loan he will be able to capture more market share and his business will grow.

loans.use: To buy retail stock products of daily household use items

loans.name: Munywoki

texts.en:
Munywoki sells vegetables and fruits in Makueni town and she has been in this business for the past 12 years. She is 63-years-old and married with 6 children. 

This will be her fifth loan term with Kiva partner KADET LTD and she plans to use the amount to buy vegetables, onions, tomatoes and oranges to sell. She will use the generated profits to provide the basic needs of her family.

She hopes to grow her business, get more income and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for building materials

loans.name: Abdul Rahim

texts.en:
This is forty-year-old Abdul. He is married and has four children aged three, five, eight and fourteen. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him, and he is helping to pay for the education of his sister's child. 

In 2007, Abdul established his used clothing business. He began his business, after coming from the mines, to be self reliant. His business is located in the city center, and his main customers are ladies. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 2,315,175 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Abdul has already received and successfully repaid five loans, and now requires a new loan in order to pay for additional ladies jeans, blouses and T-shirts. He hopes that this loan can improve the stock and allow for expansion. In the future, Abdul plans to expand the business to a new location within the market, and he hopes to be able to do wholesale. 

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy used clothing.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a divorced woman. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 6 years, she has operated a food vending business, selling from home to her neighbors. She dreams of expanding to a café business.
With the 25,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour, and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Mwari

texts.en:
Mwari is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past six years, she has operated a food kiosk business, selling foodstuffs such as maize flour, rice and cooking fat to her neighbors and passersby. Seasonality is her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 25,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with four children, all of whom go to school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past 4 years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
Roberto, es un joven, vive con sus padres. El se dedica a la venta de cds de musica y dvd de peliculas como una fuente de ingreso para obtener ganancias. 
El prestamo que  requiere le permitirá comprar mercadería tales  como: cds de música de diferentes artistas y asimismo de películas de todo tipo; esta inversion le ayudara a aumentar las ganancias y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
Su sueño es brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Toberto is a young man who lives with his parents. He sells music CDs and movie DVDs as a source of income to make money. The loan that he needs will allow him to buy merchandise such as various artists' music CDs and all types of movies. This loan will help him increase his earnings and meet his customers' needs. His dream is to be able to provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy various artists' music CDs and all types of movies.

loans.name: Fadwa

texts.en:
Fadwa is a 54-year-old widow.  In order to be able to support herself and family and to cover living expenses, Fadwa had to start a small business at home in addition to working a full time job. 

Her home business is making decorative pieces while focusing on making vases in different styles and sizes. Now Fadwa is applying for a loan to get some decorative materials and wood for making boxes and basic materials to make more shapes of decorative pieces such as table lamps, frames and others.

loans.use: to get some decorative materials and wood for making boxes.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a 44-year-old conservative woman, so her daughter Rana took her place in the photo.

Her husband works in making furniture at a governmental entity to support their 6 children, while Halima started a home-based food market where she started to sell snacks to kids and enhanced it to include some basic food items like spaghetti, rice, sugar, salt, etc.

Now Halima is seeking a loan to add and sell more types of food products and a few types of detergents.

loans.use: to add and sell more types of food products and a few types of detergents

loans.name: Vitoria

texts.en:
Vitoria is a 29-year-old business woman from Liberia. She is unmarried and has three children. Two of her children are currently attending school, and they all live at home. She did not attend school but she states that she is good at managing her business. She describes herself as hardworking.

She lives and works in Gbarnga, the capital City of Bong County. Bong is located in the center of the country and is an agricultural hub.  The majority of the residents are farmers growing rice, palm oil and cassava. 

Vitoria has a table business, from which she has sold palm oil and dry meat for the past five years. She works 9 hours per day at her business. Her greatest challenge in the business is having few goods. She intends to use the loan to buy more palm oil and dry meat for her business. She started in business by working as a caretaker. She likes her business because she gets money from her business for her personal use. She hopes to one day own a house.
  
She wants to thank the Kiva lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil and dry meat for her business.

loans.name: Santos Basilio

texts.es:
Santos tiene 40 años, de edad, reside en una comunidad muy lejos de la ciudad, es padre soltero de 2 hijas, pues su esposa murió hace ya tres años a causas de la enfermedad del reumatismo. el venia luchando con ella y a raíz de ello,  se vio obligado a vender la casa donde vivían  para ver de mejorar la salud de la esposa. 

Hoy en día, vive en una casa alquilada de bahareque con su familia. Sus hijas le ayudan en los que haceres del hogar, una trabaja en la ciudad como ama de casa, la menor estudia en una escuela, tiene que caminar por cerca de 30 minutos para llegar al destino. Él antes trabajaba tejiendo hamacas que luego las iban a vender a la ciudad, hoy en día  trabaja en la agricultura (siembra de maíz, frijoles y maicillo) para el sustento de la familia.


Para comprar los insumos para las siembras de granos básicos en  la ciudad mas cercana, que le queda a 20 minutos para salir a la carretera a tomar el autobús o sino en algún carro que circule  por la zona, en autobús le toma cerca de 30 minutos para llegar.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 8 sacos de abono, herbicidas, pesticidas para su cultivo de maíz, fríjol y maicillo.  Con la inversión, espera obtener un mayor rendimiento en cuanto a la producción, pues posee una amplia experiencia. Planea en el futuro comprar un terreno donde construir su propia casa y a la vez lucha cada día para ayudar a su hija en los estudios básicos.
texts.en:
Santos is 40 years old, lives in a residential community far from the city, is a single father of 2 daughters as his wife died three years ago due to complications with rheumatism. He continued fighting with her and for her. He was obligated to sell the house where they lived in order to improve his wife's health.

Today he lives in a rented mud house with his family. His daughters help him with the household chores; one works in the city as a housekeeper, the younger one studies in school, she has a 30 minute walk to arrive at her destination. Previously he worked making hammocks which he then sold in the city. Today he works farming (planting beans and corn) to support his family.

In order to buy the items to plant basic grains in the nearest city, it takes him 20 minutes to get to the highway to then take a bus or a car that travels throughout the area. The bus takes 30 minutes to arrive to the city.

The loan that he seeks with Fundación Campo is to buy 8 sacks of fertilizer, herbicide, and pesticide for his corn, beans and millet.  With the investment, he hopes to get a better result as far as crop production as he has a lot of experience. In the future he plans to buy land where he can build his own house and fight every day to help his daughter with her basic education.

loans.use: to buy 8 sacks of fertilizer, herbicide, and pesticide for his corn, beans and millet.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
This is Marivic. Her previous loan helped her a lot, not just in her business but even in her everyday expenses especially for her children's education. She has been in this business for six years now. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Marivic hopes that her store will be a grocery store and she dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Mustapha

texts.en:
This is thirty-one-year-old Mustapha.  He is married and has one child, aged two.

In 2008, Mustapha established his barbering business. He began his business because he wanted to be self reliant. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about 995,250 SLL every month from this business.

He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Mustapha requires a loan in order to pay for an additional barbering comb, generator and fan. He hopes that this loan can improve on the shop and increase his customers. In the future, Mustapha plans to change the small wooden kiosk to a metal kiosk, and also plans to expand and open outlets with the town. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for barbering comb, generator and fan

loans.name: Sao I.

texts.en:
This is forty-year-old Sao.  She is married and has four children aged four, five, eight and fifteen. She has one additional dependent who lives with her to assist her in-law with her child's education.

In 2007, Sao established her used clothing business. She began her business because she wants to help her husband with running the affairs of the home. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are ladies. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,960,300 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Sao has already received and successfully repaid four loans and now requires a new loan in order to pay for additional ladies blouses and pants. She hopes that this loan can improve the stock. In the future, Sao plans to develop the business and improve the shop she has moved into. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy used clothing to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia works hard to support her family. Alicia is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Alicia has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Alicia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines.

Nida requested a PHP 11500 loan through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell.

She has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Nida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Mirna Yoany

texts.es:
Mirna, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque necesita invertir en el negocio de tortillas que posee; este le permitirá comprar la materia prima necesaria tales como: maíz, gas propano y pago de mano de obra.
El efecto del crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar sus ganancias y estas las utiliza para comprar alimentación y vestuario a sus hijos; con la inversión del crédito ha mejorado su situación económica y se encuentra muy bien de salud su familia.
texts.en: Mirna is applying for a new loan because she needs to invest in her tortilla business. It will permit her to buy the items she needs such as corn, propane gas, and pay labor help. The previous loan helped her increase her earnings and those earning she used to buy food and clothing for her children; with the loan she has  improved her economic situation and her family's health is good.

loans.use: to buy corn, propane gas, and pay labor help..

loans.name: Dorris

texts.en:
Dorris is a 38-year-old businesswoman from Liberia. She is married and has three children between 15 and 11; all three of them are currently attending school and live at home. She completed grade 7 before starting her business. She describes herself as hardworking.

She lives and works in Gbarnga, the capital City of Bong County. Bong is located in the centre of the country and is an agricultural hub. The majority of residents are farmers growing rice, palm oil and cassava. 

Dorris has a table business, selling local soap for the past two years. She works 10 hours a day at her business. Her greatest challenge in business is having few goods. She intends to use the loan to buy more soap. She started her business by selling soap for her mother. She likes her business because she gets money from her business for her personal use. She hopes to one day own a shop.  

She wants to thank the Kiva lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to buy more soap.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
