Alice is a 31-year-old business woman from Liberia. She is unmarried and has 3 children, between 13 and 5 years old. Three of them are currently attending school and live at home. She has completed grade 12 before starting her business. She describes herself as hardworking.

She lives and works in Gbarnga, the capital City of Bong County. Bong is located in the center of the country and is an agricultural hub.  The majority of the residents are farmers growing rice, palm oil and cassava. 

Alice has a table business, from which she has sold rice, pepper, beans, etc. for the past 7 years. She works 10 hours per day at her business. Her greatest challenge in the business is having few goods. She intends to use the loan to buy more rice, pepper, beans, etc. She started her business by selling palm oil for her oldest sister. She likes her business because she gets money from her business for her personal use. She hopes to one day own a house for her children.
  
She wants to thank the Kiva lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to buy more rice, pepper, beans, etc.

loans.name: Lana

texts.en:
Lana is a 27-year-old conservative married lady. She asked her husband, who works two jobs, to take her place in the photo.
 
Having three kids and living in a rented house has lead Lana to start a retail business selling clothes, blankets, and bed sheets from home. Her business depends on the word of mouth as a promoting channel. She now wants to increase the quantity she has of clothes before Ramadan, the holy month, starts. She is searching for a suitable shop to open an independent clothing store in the future. For that reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to increase the quantity she has of clothes to sell before Ramadan, the holy month, starts

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en:
Lisa is a 20-year-old business woman from Liberia. She is single and has a two-year-old child, who is currently attending school and lives at home.  She has completed grade 8 before starting her business. She describes herself as hardworking.

She lives and works in Gbarnga, the capital City of Bong County. Bong is located in the center of the country and is an agricultural hub.  The majority of the residents are farmers growing rice, palm oil and cassava. 

Lisa has a cook shop and has sold rice and soup for the past two years. She works 9 hours per day at her business. Her greatest challenge in the business is low income. She intends to use the loan to buy more ingredients, such as pepper, fish, meat, onions, vita, etc. She started her business by selling soap for her mother. She likes her business because she gets money from her business for her personal use.  She hopes to one day own a shop.  

She wants to thank the Kiva lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients, such as pepper, fish, meat, onions, vita, etc.

loans.name: Gulmumin

texts.en:
Gulmumin was born in 1961 in the Nosiri Khusrav area of Shahritus. He lives in the warmest region of Tajikistan. Gulmumin lives with his wife. His wife is a housewife. They have four lovely children, three boys and the youngest is a daughter.

Gulmumin is involved in agriculture. He rents 15 hectares of land where he is sowing agricultural crops for sale. From this kind of activity he earns enough for the basics. He has a small, modest home.

In rural areas, many residents breed cattle at home, but most of them do not trade cattle. Gulmumin has a few head of sheep, two cows, a calf and a bull. He culls every half year a goby or a sheep and prepares Kayla. Kayla is fried meat with a fatty tail, which is salted and stored in a dark, cool place. 

Gulmumin requested a loan to start his business. He wants to buy goats, sheeps and calves. He claims to know the business through family tradition, and his son will help him. 

Gulmumin has several benefits to help him to achieve his goal. He has a wealth of experience and a cowshed, where he will raise cattle.

He wants to become an important small business owner and improve the quality of life for his wife and four children. Gulmumin believes in himself and believes that people will help him. He is a very hardworking person. His goal is to improve his economic situation so he can buy land. His children are almost adults, and they need to obtain a higher education.

loans.use: to buy goats, sheeps and calves to start his business

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 33-years-old and married with two children currently in school, Analiza works very hard to provide for them.

Analiza runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to purchase additional stock such as canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, soft-drinks, biscuits, etc. to sell in her general store.

Analiza has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, soft-drinks, biscuits, etc. 

In the future, Analiza would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock such as canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, soft-drinks, biscuits, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 34 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Josephine works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Josephine has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as bread, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks and other groceries. 

Josephine would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 75 years old and married with eight children.

Yolanda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Yolanda has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 45 years and also earns an income from charcoal sales.

Yolanda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter was born in 1975 in Rwakigaju – Kashayo Bugangari, Rukungiri District. He was born into a peasant family and studied up to the basic level (primary level) due to limited funds. He was unable to continue with studies, and he struggled to earn a living from a very early age.

Peter is married with three children; two of them attend school and the third one is still young.

In 2012, he started constructing a house but he found out that he could not finish the house using the money from his business. So he joined UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) for financial assistance. He took a loan and was able to construct and reach a certain level. He also took this loan to buy roofing materials. 

He is now taking this new loan to finish up his house while still leaving his business resources untouched. The client thanks UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) for the financial assistance, which enabled him to construct his house without affecting his business.

loans.use: To buy roofing materials

loans.name: Fatime

texts.en:
Fatime is a a 35-years-old married mother of four children. She and her family live in a minority community in in the southern part of Kosovo. Fatime is a housewife and stay at home mother, taking care of her children and house while his husband  works as a painter.

This wonderful and loving family lives in unacceptable and substandard conditions and the money her husband  generates is not enough to to do any renovations to the house.  Fatmie is requesting a loan so that they may renovate their house, specifically to address the insulation and heat loss problems they experience in the winter months. Not only will this loan help them to improve their living conditions keeping the home warm and the family healthy, but due to the high cost of electricity the renovations will also help them to to save costs on heating in the winter. 

She hopes that cutting some of the costs of utilities will enable them to save some of the money from her husband's salary in order to ensure financial security. In the near future she is hoping to have better conditions for her family. Fatime is very happy for this opportunity and she thanks all of the lenders!

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Hanumsha

texts.en:
Hanumsha is married and has two children. She lives in the southern part of Kosovo. Hanumsha's family lives in a small old house, and it has not had any repairs or renovation in the past several years.  She is a housewife and her husband works in construction. 

Her house has a problem with insulation and keeping the heat inside so during the winter it is very difficult for them to stay warm. Heating a home is a basic need necessary to live comfortably and keep good health. At this time she is requesting a loan so that she can have her windows renovated in order to be able to create better living conditions for the family. She hopes in the future to have a better life and continue to improve the living conditions for her family. She appreciates all Kiva lenders and is grateful for the help.

loans.use: to renovate windows

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina is a 36-year-old business woman from Liberia. She is married and has a 16-year-old child who is currently attending school and lives at home. She  completed 7th grade before starting her business. She describes herself as hardworking.

She lives and works in Gbarnga, the capital city of Bong County. Bong is located in the centre of the country and is an agricultural hub. The majority of residents are farmers growing rice, palm oil and cassava. 

Tina has a cook shop business and has sold rice and soup along with drinks for the past five years now.  She works 10 hours at her business. Her greatest challenge in business is less income. She intends to use the loan to buy more rice, pepper, onions, fish, meat, drinks, etc. She started her business by selling to her friends. She likes her business because she makes more money. She hopes to one day own a house.  

She wants to thank the Kiva lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to buy more rice, pepper, onions, fish, meat, drinks etc.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Delia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from pig fattening. Delia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: Jessica is a hard-working entrepreneur who has an internet cafe business in the Philippines. Jessica is requesting a PHP25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional computers for her internet cafe business. She has been in this business for five years. Jessica earns more income from her general store. Jessica has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional computers for her business.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 48-years-old and married with six children, two of whom are in school. Amelita works very hard to provide for them.

Amelita runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Amelita has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items including canned goods, snack foods and other groceries. 

In the future, Amelita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Leonila works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a carinderia/eatery.  Leonila is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Kiva partner NWTF in order to purchase more goods such as laundry soap, shampoo, sugar, noodles, eggs, etc. to sell in her general store.

Leonila successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Leonila has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more goods such as laundry soap, shampoo, sugar, noodles, eggs, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is thirty-one-year-old Aminata. She is widowed and has two children aged three and seven. In 2010, Aminata established her provisions, toiletries and cigarette business. She began her business because she wants to be self reliant after losing ther husband. 

Her business is located in the city center, and her main customers are of all ages. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 600,887 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Aminata requires a loan in order to pay for sugar, caustic soda and cigarettes. 

She hopes that this loan can improve her stock. In the future, Aminata plans to improve the business and to expand into the trade of recharge cards. She hopes to be able to take care of her children to the university level. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for sugar, caustic soda and cigarettes

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
This is forty-two-year-old Hassan. He is married and has four children aged two, five, seven and fifteen. He has three additional dependents, who live with him to assist his younger brother and sisters in their schooling.  

In 1997, Hassan established his provision, toiletries, cigarette, and soft drinks business. He began his business because he wants to be self reliant after coming from the village. His business is located in the city center, and his main customers are all ages and sexes. Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,700,437 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Hassan has already received and successfully repaid four loans, and now requires a new loan in order to pay for additional recharge cards. He hopes that this loan can expand the trade on recharge cards and maximize the profit. In the future, Hassan plans to improve the business and open outlets within the town. He hopes to be able to care for the needs of the children to the university level. 

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for recharge cards

loans.name: Siaway

texts.en: Siaway is 33 years old, she is unmarried and lives in Gbarnga in Liberia. Gbarnga is located in the center of Liberia in Bong County. The majority of the people there are employed as rice, palm oil or cassava farmers. Siaway runs a business selling palm oil, vita, tomatoes, onions, etc. She has had this business for the past four years. Siaway works 9 hours each day. She transports her goods to her business by shared taxi. The biggest challenge she faces in her business is having fewer goods on her table than other sellers. Siaway went to school, but stopped in grade six. She has three children between the ages of 12 and 8.  With the proceeds from the requested loan, she would like to buy palm oil, vita, tomatoes, onions, etc. to resell. She describes herself as a hard-working woman. She started her business with money from her mother. In the future, she would like to own a house. She is proud of her business because she makes money. Siaway would like to say thank you to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, vita, tomatoes, onions, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Vegaspamba  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Vegaspamba está formado por 11 socias quienes son vecinas y amigas de una misma comunidad que pertenece a la parroquia de Jadan en Cuenca, este lugar es de clima frió, tiene exuberante vegetación y verdes campos, su arquitectura es una mezcla de la antiguo y lo modernos. Su gente se dedica a la agricultura, crianza de animales y artesanías como es la elaboración de sogas, algunos salen diariamente a la ciudad a ejercer diferentes actividades económicas. Aun mantener viva su cultura y tradiciones. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Rosa Balvina, es una socia fundadora del grupo de crédito Vegaspamba, le gusta esta forma de créditos porque le dan la oportunidad de crecer en su actividad económica y a su vez compartir un tiempo con sus amigas y vecinas.

La Señora Rosa Balvina tiene 62 años, es viuda pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos mayores de edad que están casados y viven independientes, ella vive con un nieto a quien lo crio desde que era un bebe, ahora el tiene 14 años y está estudiando en un colegio de la localidad. No tiene casa propia por o que vive en una casa prestada.

Doña Rosa Balvina se dedica a la cría de borregos, gallinas y becerros, también se dedica a la agricultura la cual es para el consumo de su hogar y si existe un sobrante lo vende. Aun no ha perdido el oficio que aprendió de sus padres  el cual es la elaboración de soga. 

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de alimento para sus animales y 
Nylon para la elaboración de sogas. 

Su meta es continuar creciendo en su actividad económica.
texts.en:
The Vegaspamba communal bank is made up of 11 members. They are neighbors and friends from the same community, which belongs to the parish of Jadan in Cuenca. This area has a cold climate, lush vegetation, and green fields. Its architecture is a mix of old-fashioned and modern. Its people work in agriculture, raising animals, and artisan crafts, such as making rope. Some of them go out to the city every day for business. They still keep their culture and traditions alive.

One of the members of this group is Rosa Balvina. She is a founding member of the Vegaspamba communal bank. She likes this type of loans because they give her the opportunity to grow her business and spend time with her friends and neighbors at the same time.

Rosa Balvina, 62, is a widow. She has six children from her marriage. They are adults who are married and live independently. She lives with her grandson, whom she has raised since he was a baby. He is now 14 and is studying in a secondary school in the town. She does not have her own house, so she lives in a house which belongs to someone else.

Rosa Balvina raises lambs, chickens, and calves. She also works in agriculture to feed her household, and if there is extra, she sells it. She still has not given up the work which she learned from her parents, which is making rope.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of animal feed and nylon to make rope.

Her goal is to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and nylon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more patented drugs.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: As a married parent of three children, Judith works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Judith is requesting a PHP29,500 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business. Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en: Luzminda is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP15,000 through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat. Luzminda has been in this business for 15 years. Luzminda earns more income from her general store and tricycle transport businesses. Luzminda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Harritta

texts.en:
Harritta is 26 years old, married and lives in from Gbarnga in Liberia. Gbarnga is located in the centre of Liberia in Bong County. The majority of people are employed as farmers cultivating crops such as rice, palm oil and cassava.  

She has had a table business selling fish for the past eight years. She works at her business 10 hours a day. She transports her goods to her business by taxi. The biggest challenge she faces in her business is few goods on her table. She went to school and finished grade 7. She has a one-year-old child at home. With the proceeds from the loan, Harritta wants to have enough fish for her business.  She describes herself as a hardworking woman.  

Harritta started her business with money from her mother. In the future, she wants to own a house. She is proud of her business because she gets money for her expenses. She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to have enough fish for her business.

loans.name: Quita

texts.en:
Quita is a 30-year-old business woman from Liberia.  She is unmarried and has four children, between 11 years and 7 months.  Three of them are currently attending school and they all live at home.  She did not go to school and she describes herself as hardworking.

She lives and works in Gbarnga, the capital City of Bong County. Bong is located in the center of the country and is an agricultural hub.  The majority of residents are farmers growing rice, palm oil and cassava. 

For the past seven years, Quita has had a table business which sells rice and bread.  She works 12 hours a day at her business.  Her greatest challenge in business is fewer goods. She intends to use the loan to buy more rice and bread to resell. She started her business by selling for her friends.  She likes her business because she makes more profit.  She hopes to one day own a house and a car.  

She wants to thank the Kiva lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to buy more rice and bread to resell.

loans.name: Sando

texts.en:
Sando is a 35-year-old businesswoman from Liberia.  She is unmarried and has two children, aged 10 and 5.  Both of them are currently attending school and live at home.  She had completed grade 12 before starting her business.  She describes herself as hardworking.

She lives and works in Gbarnga, the capital City of Bong County. Bong is located in the centre of the country and is an agricultural hub.  The majority of residents are farmers growing rice, palm oil and cassava. 

for the past two years, Sando has had a table business which sells oil.  She works ten hours at day at her business.  Her greatest challenge in business is fewer goods. She intends to use the loan to buy more oil to resell. She started her business by selling for people.  She likes her business because the business helps to sustain her family.  She hopes to one day own a house.  

She wants to thank the Kiva lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to buy more oil to resell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a widow. She owns a house that has no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and food for her children.

She has operated a business selling clothes for the past six years. She sells in a shop to her town dwellers, passersby and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es: Claudia Patricia es una mujer de 31 años de edad, madre de un hijo de 8 años. Se dedica a la confección, gracias a una amiga que le dio a conocer dicha actividad; ha realizado cursos de confección en el SENA y ha laborado en empresas de confección donde ha adquirido más experiencia en la elaboración de todo tipo de prendas de vestir, disfraces y haciendo arreglos. El crédito lo desea invertir en la compra de una máquina de puntadas, para realizar todo tipo de puntadas que permitan obtener una prenda mucho más pulida y así brindar mejor calidad a sus clientes, con lo que se incrementarán sus ingresos y mejorará la calidad de vida que le brinda a su pequeño hijo. Su mayor sueño es poder ampliar su taller de confección y de esta forma generar otras oportunidades de empleo.
texts.en:
Claudia Patricia is 31 years old and has an eight-year-old son. She works as a seamstress, thanks to a friend who told her about this activity. She took sewing classes at SENA and has worked in sewing companies, where she acquired more experience in making all types of clothing, costumes, and making repairs. 

She would like to invest this loan in the purchase of a sewing machine to sew all types of stitches. This will allow her to make a much more polished garment and offer a better quality to her clients. She can then raise her income and improve her young son's quality of life.

Her greatest dream is to expand her sewing workshop, therefore generating more employment opportunities.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 40 years old, unmarried and lives in Gbarnga in Liberia. Gbarnga is located in the center of Liberia in Bong County. The majority of people are employed as farmers, cultivating crops such as rice, palm oil and cassava.  

She has had a table business selling fresh fish for the past five years. She works at her business nine hours a day. She transports her goods to her business by taxi. The biggest challenge she faces in her business is less goods on her table. She did not go to school. She has nine children between 20 and 5 years old.  

With the proceeds from the loan she wants to buy fresh fish to resell. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. She started her business with money from her mother. In the future, she wants to own a house. She is proud of her business because of the way customers buy from her.  

She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish to resell.

loans.name: Jelita

texts.en: Jelita is a 47-year-old, married woman with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Jelita has a basket-weaving business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP12,000 loan from NWTF to buy additional materials for her basket-weaving business. Jelita has been in this business for two years. In the future, Jelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her basket-weaving business.

loans.name: Eliana Cristina

texts.es: Eliana Cristina es una mujer de 28 años de edad, madre de un hijo de 6 años. Es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora, desde muy joven le agrada todo lo relacionado con la belleza y comenzó a desempeñarse en esta actividad desde los 15 años, cuando le colaboraba a una amiga haciendo manicure y pedicure y así comenzó a generar sus propios ingresos. Ha realizado cursos de capacitación en belleza y se convirtió en estilista. Hace aproximadamente 1 año se había asociado con una amiga pero han tenido algunas dificultades, por lo que decidió independizarse. El crédito lo desea invertir en la compra de productos de belleza (tintes, esmaltes para uñas, maquillaje), muebles y enseres para montar su propia sala de belleza.  Su mayor sueño es hacer crecer su negocio, ser muy reconocida y así poder mejorar sus ingresos para adquirir su casa propia, poder sacar su hijo adelante y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Eliana Cristina is 28 years old and has a six-year-old son. She is an enterprising woman and a fighter. From a young age, she liked everything that had to do with beauty. She started to develop herself in this business at the age of 15, when she and a friend did manicures and pedicures and she started to earn her own income. She has taken beauty training courses and she became a stylist. About one year ago, she joined up with a friend, but they had some problems, so she decided to become independent. 

She would like to invest this loan in the purchase of beauty products (hair dye, nail polish, and makeup), furniture, and equipment to open her own beauty salon. Her greatest dream is to grow her business, to become very well-known, and to improve her income so she can have her own house, provide for her son, and give him a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beauty products (hair dye, nail polish, makeup), furniture, and equipment.

loans.name: Shalva

texts.en:
Shalva is 40-years-old. He lives in Kutaisi, West Georgia with his 32-year-old wife and 12-year-old son. In the past, Shalva has requested loans from local financial institutions for family business start-up but without any success. His loan requests have always been rejected because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Shalva is a shoe tailor. He works at the local sewing studio for a small monthly salary. Mamuka is trying to work as hard as he can but his small salary is the only income for the family and it is rarely enough for food for them.

Shalva requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Shalva has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit Shalva will purchase raw materials to sew shoes. He wants to use his free time after work to start sewing shoes himself from his house fpr private orders. As he will not be dependent only on a salary, Shalva will earn a good profit. Part of the profit will be used to cover the family expenses and another part to reinvest in the same field. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to sew shoes.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen De Patria Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Virgen de Carmen de patria” en el poblado de Patria.  (El poblado de Patria se destaca por el comercio de productos de la selva, así como servicios de alojamiento y restaurantes. Punto de ingreso al Parque Nacional del Manu.)

Flor Maria tiene 40 años de edad,  es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene cinco hijos, ella y su familia viven en el poblado de Patria.  

Flor Maria es una persona responsable y amable que sale adelante pues su actividad económica principal es la venta y compra de yuca entonces ella compra a diferentes agricultores de la zona para luego que en su pequeño camión trasladé la mercadería para que después distribuirlos a los comerciantes de diferentes mercados de la ciudad del Cusco, ella lleva la mercadería una vez a la semana a la ciudad del Cusco entonces en esta oportunidad Flor maría requiere el préstamo para comprar más yucas para incrementar su capital de negocio. 

Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios se dedican a la agricultura, a la elaboración de muebles, a brindar servicio de transportes, venta de frutas y otras cosas más. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. 

(Los socios se reunieron en dos turnos diferentes por motivos de trabajo y entonces  se les tomo dos fotografías). 

(El poblado de Patria está ubicado dentro del distrito de Kosñipata en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco).
texts.en:
The communal bank “Virgen de Carmen de Patria” was formed by a group of neighbors and friends in the town of Patria.  (The town of Patria is known for its trade in products from the forest, as well as lodging services and restaurants.  It is the point of entrance of the National Park of Manu.)

Flor Maria is 40 years old.  She is married, and she and her husband have 5 children.  Flor Maria lives with her family in the town of Patria.

Flor Maria is a responsible and kind person who is getting ahead through her business buying and selling cassava.  She buys from various farmers in the area, transporting the products in her small truck to later distribute to the retailers in different markets in the city of Cusco.  She transports her products once a week to the city of Cusco.  At this time, Flor Maria needs a loan to buy more cassava to increase her working capital.

This communal bank is made up of people who are constantly seeking opportunities to get ahead.  With their daily efforts, they are providing a better future for their children.  The members of this group work in agriculture, furniture-making, transportation, fruit sales, and other activities.  They appreciate the opportunity that is being provided, and they promise to comply with the payment terms on their loans.  (The members met in 2 different shifts to work and then to take the photographs).  

The town of Patria is located in the Kosñipata district of the province of Paucartambo, in the department of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy cassava

loans.name: Fernando Antonio

texts.es: Fernando Antonio es un hombre de 32 años de edad, está casado y es padre de un hijo de 12 años. Siempre le ha gustado ser independiente y hace cuatro años montó su propia tienda de abarrotes. Es un hombre trabajador y muy organizado, ha sacado a su familia adelante con los ingresos que le ha generado su negocio. El crédito lo desea invertir en la compra de un enfriador y más surtido para su negocio (productos lácteos, galletas, carnes frías, productos de aseo y todos los productos de la canasta familiar en general). Su mayor sueño es hacer crecer las ventas en su negocio, que le generen mayor nivel de ingresos económicos para poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa e hijo y, adicionalmente poder generar oportunidades de empleo para otras personas.
texts.en:
Fernando Antonio is 32, married, and father to a twelve year old son. He has always liked to be independent, and four years ago he set up his own grocery store. He is hardworking and organized and was able to get his family ahead with the income that his business has generated. 

The loan is to invest in a refrigerator and more stock for his business such dairy products, cookies, cold cuts, toiletries, and all the general products a family needs. His biggest dream is to grow his business’s sales, so that it can make a higher level of economic income to be able to offer a better quality of life for his wife and son. Additionally, he hopes to be able to generate opportunities for employment of other people.

loans.use: purchase a refrigerator and more stock for his business such dairy products, cookies, cold cuts, and toiletries

loans.name: Inocencio Miguel

texts.es: Inocencio Miguel es un hombre de 38 años de edad, soltero y no tiene hijos. Hace más de 13 años se dedica a la producción y venta de fritos como empanadas, deditos, buñuelos, papas, entre otros. Conoce la actividad gracias a su madre que desde pequeño lo fue involucrando con el negocio y así fue aprendiendo todo lo que hoy en día sabe. Es un hombre trabajador  y dedicado, se levanta en la madrugada para comenzar a hacer los productos que posteriormente frita en una olla artesanal sobre un fogón de leña. El crédito lo desea invertir en la compra de una estufa industrial que funcione con cilindro de gas propano, lo que le permitirá hacer sus productos en menor tiempo y así poder sacar más producción que le ayude a incrementar sus ingresos económicos. Su mayor sueño es lograr aumentar su producción y sus ventas, con el fin de comenzar un ahorro para comprarse un lote.
texts.en: Inocencio Miguel is a 38 year-old man. He is single and has no children.  For more than 13 years, he has been making and selling fried foods such as empanadas, cheese sticks, fried dough balls, fried potatoes, and other foods.  He learned this trade from his mother when he was young.  She involved him in the business, and this way he learned everything that he knows today.  Inocencio Miguel is a hardworking and dedicated man who gets up at dawn to start making the products that he will later fry in a traditional pot over a wood fire.  He will invest this loan in the purchase of an industrial stove that uses propane gas cylinders.  This will enable him to make his products faster so that he can produce more and increase his income.  His main dream is to increase his production and sales so that he can start saving to buy some land.

loans.use: to buy an industrial stove that runs on propane gas cylinders

loans.name: Goldei Group

texts.en:
“ I had a challenging and difficult upbringing with my stepmother and stepbrother,” says Kimneichong, who is the featured borrower in the Goldei Group. She is pictured with her hand raised. The sudden demise of her father shocked her mother for a long time, which left her with no other option but to take care of her mother and brother. She had been running errands for a pharmacy shop in the town market since her childhood days, from where she learned how to maneuver a drug shop. The owner of the drug shop usually taught her and says “you can run one as well” and she was very confident about it. The owner of the drug shop operates with a license and her B.Pharm Degree. It has been more than a couple of years since she has been running a drug shop in the town market.

Kimneichong runs a drug shop at the center of the town market. The town is about 40 kms away from the capital town of Imphal. She runs the drug shop with the assistance of the doctors posted in the District Health Centre. The nurses in the town and the villages also suggest the drugs that are most often required.  She initially started the business on her own but after her marriage, her husband has been giving a hand. She gets the drug supplies from the main town and sells them in the town market. Sometime her husband runs errands for Kimneichong. She profits a good amount from the drug shop because there are very few drug shops in the whole area. She wanted to run the drug shop with an abundant supply of drugs but usually ends up with a shortage of supplies. The insufficient capital is always the main reason for the shortage of stocks in the drug shop.

With the Kiva loan, Kimneichong will refill the drug store and will earn more money. In the future, she will employ a trained nurse to give first aid services to the town and the nearby villages. She wants to make her living by selling life-saving drugs and provide the town with first aid medical services. The government-run district hospitals are defunct t due to the absence of staff, which leaves the town with no other options but to go to the city. She also plans to purchase a used minivan in the future and use it for public transport between the town and the main city.

The rest of the group members are engaged in selling export garments from neighboring states, weaving, running a piggery and running a Paan shop. Kimneichong says her gratitude towards Kiva and WSDS is not justified by words. The contribution is appreciated by all the group members and they will always remain obliged. She says “Thank You Kiva.”

loans.use: To restock her pharmacy with more drugs and first aid supplies.

loans.name: Malvina

texts.en:
Malvina is 21 years old. She lives in the Kutaisi district, with her parents, 16-year-old brother and 20-year-ld sister. Malvina requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of her low income and her family’s poor living conditions.

The family owns a small plot of agricultural land where vegetables are grown. Harvested products are sold at the local market. Malvina's father has a car that he drives as a taxi to earn additional income for the family.

Malvina requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Malvina has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With her credit, Malvina will open a café. She will pay the rent and purchase all the needed equipment and products to open the business. She already has found a very good place for a café. This place is in a populous area and Malvina hopes that it will help the business to be successful. She will work in the café herself, in order to have minimum expenses. Part of the profit will be reinvested in the same field. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To open a café

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past years, she has operated a food kiosk business, selling foodstuffs like maize flour, rice, and cooking fat to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge and she dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KSHS 50,000, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Thirty-three-year-old Lia lives in Batumi district with her retired mother and 61-year-old father. Lia requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of her low income and her family’s poor living conditions.
 
Lia is a teacher. She is working at the local school as a Georgian language teacher on a small monthly salary. The family gets additional income from Lia’s father’s monthly salary and her mother’s monthly pension.
 
Lia requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Lia has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With her credit, Lia will renovate an apartment to rent out. She has a space in a good area in a town. As Batumi district is becoming a very popular tourist area, there are more tourists every year spending their vacations there. Lia hopes after renovation is done, she will have no problem findung a renter immediately, to earn additional income for the family.  The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan,  will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To renovate an apartment to rent out

loans.name: Marrina

texts.en:
Marrina is 33 years old, married and lives in Gbarnga, Liberia. Gbarnga is located in the centre of Liberia in Bong County. The majority of people are employed as farmers cultivating crops such as rice, palm oil and cassava.  

Marrina has run a tailoring shop for the past eight years. She works ten hours a day at her business. She takes a taxi most of the time to buy her tailoring materials. The biggest challenge she faces in her business is that she has small capital on hand.  She did not go to grade school but she attended a tailor vocational school. Her husband sells gas. She has three children between one and fifteen years old. Only two live at home and are currently in school.  

With the proceeds from the loan she wants to buy tailoring materials such as cloth and zippers and to build good shop for her business.  She describes herself as a hardworking woman. She started her business with money from her mother. In the future, she wants to own a house. She is proud of her business because she gets money every day for her home expense.  

She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials such as cloth and zippers and to build a good shop for her business.

loans.name: Meselemani

texts.en:
Meselemani has operated a tailoring business from the market with neighbors and passersby as potential customers.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.

With the 10,000 KES, she wants to purchase cloth materials, needles, and repair her broken sewing machine.  She appreciates the previous loan which helped to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials, needles, and to repair her broken sewing machine.

loans.name: Tunapu

texts.en:
Tunapu is a 34-year-old business woman from Liberia.  She is married and has four children, between 15 and 5 years old.  All four of them are currently attending school and they all live at home.  Tunapu did not go to school.  She describes herself as hardworking.

She lives and works in Gbarnga, the capital City of Bong County. Bong is located in the centre of the country and is an agricultural hub.  The majority of residents are farmers growing rice, palm oil and cassava. 

Tunapu has sold dried fish and soap for the past five years.  She works from 7am to 5pm each day at her business.  Her greatest challenge in business is having little capital. She intends to use the loan to buy more soap and fish for her business. She started her business by selling for her mother.  She likes her business because she gets money from her business for other uses.  She hopes to one day own a house.  

She wants to thank Kiva lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to buy more soap and fish for her business.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Mariatu from Jui eastern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with two children, 3 years and 6 years old.  Over the past five years, Mariatu has established her general merchandise business. She began her business because she wanted to improve her standard of living. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price fluctuations and transportation costs.

Mariatu requires a loan in order to purchase more cigarettes, soft drinks and sugar for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. In the future, Mariatu plans to open a food store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cigarettes, soft drinks and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Nazi

texts.en:
29-year-old Nazi lives in Batumi district with her two daughters (6 and 10 years old).  Nazi requested a loan from the local financial institutions several times for a start-up business without any success.  Her loan request was always rejected due the family’s low income and poor living conditions. 

Nazi has recently opened a grocery shop and she earns a small daily income from her business.  This is the only income for the family, which is rarely enough to look after two daughters. 

Nazi requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business.  Nazi has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo.  The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products.  These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income.  With her credit, Nazi will purchase more stocks of groceries for her grocery shop.  She wants to expand her business.  Having more varieties of products to offer to the clients will significantly increase sales.  Nazi will earn a better profit and she will be able to insure a better life for her daughters.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries for her store.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees for his children.

For the past three years, he has operated a bodaboda (motorcycle) transport business. His potential customers are town dwellers. and he cites high cost of maintenance as his major challenge.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle. He joined Yehu to access loans to improve his living standard.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Isakali

texts.en:
Isakali, 36 years old, is a resident of Nsambya with five children, all of whom attend school. He went to school up to the level of secondary school, and there after hoped for businesses.

He deals in the diary business, which he started in 2008 with the aim of improving his daily income and it has been successful up to now since it is on a busy street. Isakali acquired a loan of UGX.4,000,000/= to construct his residential house, that is to say, to buy raw materials from town for the site. He mostly sells at retail and wholesale to neighborhoods and to people from different areas of the country. However, he faces the challenges of inadequate capital and competition that affects him to a certain extent.
 
Isakali is such a hard working man and very committed towards his business. His hope is to have still more money to expand, boost and open up another branch to purchase more land for the same business while looking after his family.

loans.use: To buy roofing materials for his home

loans.name: Kaday

texts.en:
This is 35 year-old Kaday from Jui, in the eastern area in Freetown.  She is married with 2 children, who are 2 and 12 years old.  She has three additional dependents living with her because they are relatives from the village.

Kaday runs a food stand business, selling palm oil, pepper, and cooking seasoning at her house.  She has been running this business for 10 years.  She works at the business 12 hours per day, 7 days per week.  She says that the main challenges to her business are lack of sufficient capital.

Kaday has requested a loan in order to purchase more local food items like palm oil, gari, and cooking seasoning.  The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and repay her loan.  In the future she plans to open a shop.  She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil, gari, and cooking seasoning.

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Memunatu from Jui eastern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with three children between the ages of 7 and 13 years.  For the past 10 years, Memunatu has operated her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to improve her standard of living. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price fluctuations and transportation costs.

Memunatu requires a loan in order to purchase more plastic slippers for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. In the future Memunatu plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic slippers for resale.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Kadiatu from Jui eastern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with three children between the ages of 18 and 25 years.  For the past 15 years, Kadiatu has operated her general merchandise business. She began her business because she wanted to improve her standard of living. She works at the business for 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price fluctuations and transportation costs.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to purchase more cigarettes, soft drinks and sugar for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business. In the future, Kadiatu plans to open a food store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cigarettes, soft drinks and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Isatu from Jui eastern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with two children, 11 and 15 years old.  Over the past 10 years, Isatu has established her food business. She began her business because she wanted to improve her standard of living. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price fluctuations and transportation costs.

Isatu requires a loan in order to purchase more soft drinks, milk, biscuits and sugar for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. In the future Isatu, plans to open a bigger food store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, milk, biscuits and sugar for resale

loans.name: Darie Blandine

texts.en: Darie Blandine is 30 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for ten years. She is married to a driver and they have two children. Both go to school. With the loan, she wants to buy more foodstuffs such as beans, rice and sugar for sale. The profits from the business will be used to put aside more savings.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie is 27 years old and married, and she lives in Gbarnga, in Liberia. Gbarnga is located in the centre of Liberia, in Bong County. The majority of people in the area are employed as farmers, cultivating crops such as rice, palm oil and cassava.
 
Mamie has a table business, where she has been selling red oil and pepper for the past six years.  She works 10 hours a day at her business.  She transports her goods to her business by bus. The biggest challenge she faces in her business is too few goods on her table.  She was not fortunate enough to go to school, herself, but her five-year-old child is in school. Her child lives at home.
  
With the proceeds from the loan, she wants to buy more red oil and pepper to resell.  She describes herself as a hardworking woman.  She started her business with money from her mother. In the future, she wants to own a house. She is proud of her business, because she earns money every day from her business. She wants to say thanks, to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to obtain more red oil and pepper, to resell.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is married, and the mother of four children. She owns a house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

For the past ten years, she has operated a business selling cereals and beans. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is stiff competition from other cereals sellers. 

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase dried maize, beans, rice and wheat, which she will resell at a profit. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business and improve her living standard.

loans.use: to purchase dried maize, beans, rice and wheat, to resell

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Musu is 45 years old and married with six children between the ages of 8 and 20 years. Two of her children are going to school. She runs a local food business in Jui eastern area in Freetown.

She's been in this business for 13 years and sells fish, palm oil, pepper and cooking seasonings. She says that the main challenge to her business is inadequate financial resources to expand her business.
 
Musu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase local food stuffs such as palm oil, sweet potatoes, coconut and mango. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to improve her standard of living and repay her loan. In the future, she would like to renovate her house. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase local food stuffs such as palm oil, sweet potatoes, coconut and mango.

loans.name: Carlitos

texts.pt:
Carlitos é casado e pai de 6 filhos, dos quais 3 estudam frequentando o nível primário e secundário. Vive na casa própria com a esposa e filhos.
Carlitos é serralheiro por conta própria e é também motorista numa empresa de criação de frangos, onde trabalha mais de oito horas por dia. O empréstimo será aplicado na compra de tubos metálicos, chapas e varões para o fabrico de várias obras na sua serralharia. Segundo ele, vai continuar a trabalhar mais e fazer mais empréstimos logo que liquidar este.
texts.en: Carlitos is married and is the father of six children, three of whom are studying in primary or secondary school.  He lives in his own home with his wife and children.  He is a blacksmith, working independently, and also is a driver in a company that raises chickens, where he works more than eight hours a day.  He will use his loan to buy metal pipes, metal sheets, and rods to make various works in his blacksmith's shop.  According to him, he is going to continue to work more and to take out more loans after he pays back this one.

loans.use: to buy metal pipes, metal sheets, and rods to make various items in his blacksmith's shop.

loans.name: Bintihamisi

texts.en:
Bintihamisi has operated a fish selling business at the market, selling to her town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing fish especially during cold currents in the deep sea. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood. She decided to join Yehu to access loans at a lower cost to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood.

loans.name: Renson

texts.en: Renson lives in Mariakani, Kenya. He is married and blessed with one child. He runs a motorcycle transport business. This has been his business for the last two years. He now seeks a loan to buy a water tank and pipes to start a water point. He has plans in five years to be owning trucks for light transport. He also has an ambition to open a retail shop. The major challenges he is facing now in doing this business are financing and seasonal weather. He plans to keep his wife busy at home as he does the transport business.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and pipes to start a water point.

loans.name: Saquina

texts.pt:
Saquina tem 25 anos de idade, vive maritalmente há 7 anos na casa da sogra tem 3 filhos dos quais apenas 1 estuda, pois os restantes são ainda menores de idade.
É comerciante há 5 anos e tem uma loja que funciona na sua casa onde vende produtos alimentares. Faz o seu negócio com a ajuda de seu esposo, com quem aprendeu a fazer negócio. Com o valor do crédito irá comprar cerveja, refrescos, sumos, óleo e outros produtos para a sua loja.
No futuro tem como planos construir a sua casa própria e oficializar a sua relação casando.
Diz que irá pagar pontualmente as prestações e voltar a pedir mais empréstimos para concretizar estes planos.
texts.en: Saquina is twenty-five.  She has lived in a common law marriage for seven years and lives in her mother-in-law's house.  She has three children, only one of whom goes to school.  The other two are still too young.  She has had a store for five years in her home where she sells food products.  She started her business with her husband's help, with whom she learned how to run the business.  With this loan, she will buy beer, soft drinks, juices, oil, and other products for her store.  In the future, she has plans to build her own house and to buy her marriage license.  She says that she will pay back her loan on time so that she can request more loans to fulfill these plans.

loans.use: to buy beer, soft drinks, juice, oil, and other products for her store.

loans.name: Margarida

texts.pt:
Margarida tem 35 anos, é professora do nível primário, vive maritalmente há 12 anos na casa própria. Tem 3 filhos dos quais 1 estuda e os outros ainda são menores de idade. Sustenta também uma sobrinha que vive na sua casa.
Com o crédito quer comprar cimento, varões, tubo de canalização e loiça sanitária, para melhorar as condições da sua casa de banho.
No futuro pretende ampliar sua casa pois actualmente vive numa tipo 2. 
Diz que irá pedir mais créditos para conseguir realizar seu plano e pretende honrar com o calendário de pagamentos.
texts.en: Margarida is thirty-five and is an elementary school teacher.  She has lived in a common law marriage for twelve years in her own home.  She has three children, one of whom goes to school.  The other two are still too young.  She supports a niece who lives in her home.  She will use this loan to buy cement, rods, pipes, and bathroom fixtures to improve the conditions of her bathroom.  In the future, she plans to expand her house.  She currently lives in a house with two bedrooms, a bathroom, and a kitchen.  She says that she will request more loans to be able to carry out her plan.  She intends to honor her repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy cement, rods, pipes, and bathroom fixtures to improve the conditions of her bathroom.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin nació en la ciudad de Huancarani pero vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata junto con su pareja y pequeña hija, él tiene 26 años de edad. Edwin es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora que sale adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación pues tiene dos actividades económicas que los distribuye para estar en sus actividades durante el día por ejemplo: en las mañanas o tardes trabaja brindando servicio de transporte urbano y en sus horas libres se dedica a administrar su tienda de abarrotes. Ya son varios años que se dedica a estos negocios y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Kusacha de Pilcopata” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, fideos y así aumentar su capital de trabajo en este rubro. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (El poblado de Pilcopata se destaca por el comercio de productos de la selva, así como servicios de alojamiento y restaurantes. Punto de ingreso al Parque Nacional del Manu.)
texts.en:
Edwin was born in the city of Huancarani, but lives in the city of Pilcopata with his wife and small daughter.  He is 26 years old.  Edwin is an enterprising and hardworking person that gets ahead with a lot of effort and dedication.  He has two business activities that he splits during his days, for example in the mornings or afternoons he offers urban transportation services and in his free time he manages a grocery store.  

He has been in these businesses for many years and they are going well thanks to the effort he puts into his work.  He is a member of the communal bank "Kusacha de Pilcopata" and requests a loan to buy more merchandise, for example sacks of rice, sacks of sugar and noodles and increase work capital in this manner.  He is thankful for and values the loan and promises to to pay his monthly quotas responsibly.  

The town of Pilcopata is known for its forestry industry, as well as lodging and restaurants.  It is a point of entrance into the Manu National Park.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise, for example, sacks of rice, sacks of sugar and noodles

loans.name: Lesly Yurany

texts.es: Lesly Yurany es una mujer de 26 años de edad,  soltera y madre de 2 hijos. Es una mujer luchadora y se esfuerza por sacar a sus hijos adelante. Hace dos años tiene una tienda donde vende abarrotes, gaseosas, lácteos, y todos los productos de la canasta familiar en general; adicionalmente posee 3 máquinas de juego tragamonedas, que le generan ingresos que le ayudan al sostenimiento de su familia. El crédito que solicita lo desea invertir en más surtido para su negocio (productos lácteos, gaseosas,  mecato, confitería, helados) con el fin de ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes y de esta forma incrementar los ingresos para cubrir todas las necesidades económicas. Su mayor sueño es sacar adelante a sus dos pequeños hijos y brindarles mejor calidad de vida, por lo que se esfuerza día tras día en su negocio.
texts.en:
Lesly Yurany is 26 years old, single and has two children.  She is determined, and works to get her children ahead.  She has had a store for two years where she sells groceries, sodas, dairy products and all of the products found in a general store.  Additionally she has three slot machines that generate income which helps with sustaining her family.  

She will invest the loan she is requesting in supplying her store (dairy products, sodas, cakes, candies and ice cream) with the goal to offer greater variety of products to her clients and increase her income to cover all economic necessities.  Her biggest dream is to get her two children ahead and offer them a better quality of life. This is why she works everyday in her store.

loans.use: to invest in more supplies for her store (dairy products, sodas, cakes, candies and ice cream)

loans.name: Ange

texts.en: Ange is 30 years old, married to a driver and is blessed with five children. She sells clothes and used shoes and has been running this business for three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay for her children school fees.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.en: Marie Louise is 30 and married with three children, 2 to 12, and all are enrolled in schools. She sells clothes and has been in the business for the past three years. With the loan, Marie Louise would like to buy more clothes for sale. She plans to use the profits for paying school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is 45 years old and married with six children between the ages of 8 and 20. Two of her children go to school. She runs a food stand business in Jui, the eastern area in Freetown.

She's been in this business for seven years and sells fish, palm oil, pepper and seasonings. She says that the main challenge to her business is inadequate financial resources to expand her business.
 
Kadiatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase cooking materials including palm oil, fish, pepper and seasonings. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her educate her children and repay her loan. In the future, she would like to renovate her house. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cooking materials including palm oil, fish, pepper and seasonings.

loans.name: Luz Amparo

texts.es: Luz Amparo es una mujer de 51 años de edad, es separada y madre de un hijo. Es una persona luchadora y trabajadora, se esfuerza por sacar adelante su hijo y su familia. Hace aproximadamente 38 años tiene una tienda donde vende licores y abarrotes, con esmero ha logrado que el negocio sea reconocido en el sector donde reside. Cada día trabaja arduas jornadas en su negocio y los fines de semana extiende el horario de atención debido a que se presenta mayor flujo de personas y posibles clientes. El crédito lo desea invertir en la compra de surtido (licores, cerveza y productos de la canasta familiar) para tener mayor diversidad y cantidad de productos que le permita satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y, adicionalmente desea cancelar el crédito que tiene vigente. Su mayor sueño es hacer crecer su negocio, tener un local más amplio o hacer mejoras locativas en su casa, que le permitan tener un local propio, y de esta forma poder economizar gastos que posteriormente pueden servir para el sostenimiento de su familia y mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz Amparo is a 51-year-old woman.  She is separated from her husband and is the mother of one son.  She is a determined and hard-working person who works to get herself and her family ahead in life.  For approximately 38 years she has had a shop where she sells liquor and groceries.  With great care she has managed to get the business well-known in the area where she lives.  Every day she works hard in her business, and on the weekends she extends her business hours because there is a greater flow of people and possible customers.  

The loan that she wants will be used to buy an assortment of inventory (liquor, beer, and basic household products) in order to have a greater variety and quantity of products that will allow her to meet the demand of her customers.  Additionally, she wishes to settle her current loan.  Her greatest dream is to grow her business, to have a larger location or to make structural improvements to her house, and to have her own place.  In this way she will be able to save expenses that she can later use to support her family and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of inventory (liquor, beer, and household products) and to pay off a loan.

loans.name: Valerie

texts.en: Valerie is 45 years old and sells juice made from bananas. She has been running the business for five years. She has requested a loan to buy more juice for sale. She is planning to use the profits to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more juice to sell.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en: Raphael is thankful for the previous loan which helped him to boost his business. He is applying for another loan to buy vegetables, such as tomatoes and potatoes, to supply his business with and to continue providing good products to his customers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as tomatoes and potatoes

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam was born in 1967 in Rujumbura, Rukungiri District. His parents were peasants so they could not manage to send him to school. When he grew up, he had to devise a means to survive so he started growing a few crops to sell on his father's land. In 2000, he bought his own land and started growing sugarcane and bananas as well as raising cows for milk production.
Sam is now married with six children who go to school and he has managed to support them using his earnings from sugarcane, bananas and milk production.
Sam has now developed his business to an improved state and now can take care of his family very well. He is requesting a loan from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) to renovate his house. He does not have enough money to renovate the house and still support the entire family.
Sam has taken out two loans previously which he has been able to repay because he is a hard-working and honest customer. Sam is so grateful to UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) for the distinguished services and support it renders to the people of Rukungiri District.In the photo Sam, left, is with a UGAFODE staff member in front of the house to be renovated.

loans.use: To buy materials for renovating his residential house

loans.name: Yendoukoua

texts.fr: Ce revendeur de pièces détachées pour voitures, père de famille, souffre d’une baisse dans ses ventes. Pour relancer et développer son commerce, il envisage de s’approvisionner en pièces hors du Togo. Toutefois les fonds dont il dispose ne suffisent pas pour un tel projet. Refusant de se décourager, cet homme dynamique fait aujourd’hui une nouvelle demande de prêt auprès de WAGES. Il est âgé de 30ans avec 01 ancienneté de 09ans.
texts.en:
This retailer of automobile replacement parts, a father, is affected by a decline in his sales. To rekindle and develop his business he is planning on purchasing parts outside of Togo. However, his financial assets are not sufficient for such a project. Refusing to be discouraged, this dynamic man is making, today, a new request  for a loan from WAGES.

He is 30 years old and has 9 years in the business.

loans.use: to purchase replacement parts for cars to sell

loans.name: Akuété

texts.fr: A 45 ans, Akuèté est ouvrier. Avec sa femme revendeuse de rue, il espère être en mesure d’offrir un meilleur avenir à son enfant âgé de 11ans. Cependant, pour continuer à exercer son métier, il a urgemment besoin d’une nouvelle moto pour se rendre tous les jours sur son lieu de travail. Il souhaiterait obtenir de WAGES un premier prêt pour effectuer cet achat essentiel pour sa vie de tous les jours.
texts.en:
Akuèté is a 45-year-old worker. His wife is a street seller; together they hope to be able to provide their 11-year-old child with a better future. However, to continue to practice his trade, he is in the urgent need of a new motorcycle to go to his workplace every day.

He wishes to obtain a first loan from WAGES to make this purchase that is necessary for his daily life.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Kossiwa, 35 ans, est revendeuse de pagnes et autres objets divers. Elle éprouve des difficultés avec son commerce et rêve d’avoir les moyens de louer une véritable boutique pour aider financièrement sa famille( elle est mariée à un transitaire et maman de 04 enfants dont 02 scolarisés). Un prêt pourrait lui permettre cela et changer radicalement sa situation pour l’instant précaire.
texts.en:
Kossiwa is 35-years old; she is a seller of “pagnes” [colorful wrap around fabric] and other various items. She is facing some difficulties with her business and dreams of being able to rent a real shop to provide financial help to her family (she is married to a freight worker and is the mother of four children, two of them in school.)

A loan would allow her to fulfill this dream and would radically change her situation that is now unstable.

loans.use: to buy "pagnes" [colorful wrap around fabric], shoes, jewelry and various items

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James of Kaata, Buyanja Rubabo – Rukungiri District was born in 1970 to a peasant family. He studied up to secondary level after which he went to train as a lay reader. He is now a lay reader at one of the local churches in rural Rukungiri.

James is now 43 years old and married with three children and all attend school. He started up a timber business in 2001 to supplement his income so as to improve the standard of living of his household since the income from the church is usually small and inadequate.

He is now looking forward to expanding his business but due to a lack of enough funds, he has decided to borrow from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) so that he can inject more funds into the timber business.

James had previously borrowed money from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) – Rukungiri Branch and managed to pay it back. He believes that he is hardworking and honest enough to pay back this loan and he appreciates all the help in order to achieve his dreams of having a well to do and sustainable family.

loans.use: To buy timber to sell

loans.name: Anne Marie

texts.en: Anne Marie, aged 50, is married with six children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is a carpenter. She sells fish and has spent ten years in the business. With this loan, she wants to add more fish to sell. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Messanh

texts.fr: Messanh a 28 ans, est marié et a 2 enfants. Il travaille tous les jours sur la zone portuaire de Lomé, mais pour ce faire à besoin d’acheter une moto pour se rendre sur place à l’heure, compte tenu de la distance à parcourir. Il sollicite donc un prêt pour pouvoir effectuer cet achat et continuer à travailler pour payer la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Messanh is 28 years old, married, and has two children.

He works all day in the Port of Lomé, but needs to buy a motorcycle to reach his place of work in time, given the distance.

So he is requesting a loan to make this purchase so he can continue working to pay for his children's education.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Amidatou

texts.fr: Revendeuse ambulante de draps, foulards et chaussures, Amidatou a à cœur de prendre soin de ses trois jeunes enfants. Mais elle a besoin d’accroitre ses revenus pour subvenir à leurs besoins, avec son mari. Elle veut être capable d’acheter davantage de stock afin de vendre davantage et peut-être, à terme, d’ouvrir une véritable boutique. Grâce aux fonds que pourrait lui prêter WAGES grâce à Kiva, elle aurait les moyens de réaliser ce rêve.
texts.en:
An itinerant retailer of sheets, scarves and shoes, Amidatou takes heart in caring for her three young children.

However she and her husband need to increase their income to meet their needs. She wants to increase her stock so she can sell more and eventually open a real store.

With funding obtained from WAGES through Kiva she would be able to afford this dream.

loans.use: buy fabrics and pagnes.

loans.name: Maeabah

texts.en:
Maeabah is a 40-year-old business woman from Liberia.  She is married and has 7 children, between 10 and 25 years old.  Only five of them are currently attending school and live at home.  She completed 5th grade before starting her business.  She describes herself as hardworking.
She lives and works in Gbarnga, the capital city of Bong County. Bong is located in the centre of the country and is an agricultural hub.  The majority of residents are farmers growing rice, palm oil and cassava. 
Maeabah has had a table business which sells lappa (traditional cloths) for the past five years.  She works from 7am to 5pm each day at her business.  Her greatest challenge in business is limited capital. She intends to use the loan to buy more lappa for her business. She started her business by selling for her friends.  She likes her business because she gets money from her business for her personal use.  She hopes to one day own a house.  
She wants to thank the Kiva lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to buy more lappa (traditional cloths) for her business.

loans.name: Ametodohoun

texts.fr: A 39 ans, Ametodohoun travaille dans le commerce de détail haricots, d’huile et d’igname. Elle cherche avant tout à accroitre ses revenus trop modestes pour assurer ne serait-ce que les besoins les plus fondamentaux de ses trois enfants. Selon elle, la meilleure solution serait à terme de pouvoir louer une boutique pour exercer son négoce. Un nouveau prêt le lui permettrait sans aucun doute.
texts.en:
At age 39, Ametodohoun is a retail merchant of beans, palm oil and yams.
